text_A: When I had to undergo the final examination of secondary school, á I lived together with a girlfriend. We both were afraid to fail, á but it appeard that we both had passed.
label: joy

text_A: When I had left my home, my father, under false pretences, got me á in his car and drove home where we were all alone. He was seethed á with rage because I withrew from his authority. He hit me, kicked á me and threatened me.
label: fear

text_A: I felt very sad when I left home because I could not stand it any á longer. I do not regret it, but I missed my little sister very á much (and she missed me). These feelings wear off over time.
label: sadness

text_A: When my mother found a leaf of my diary where I had written about á my mother's lack of education, especially her poor arithmetical á insight.
label: shame

text_A: When I was six years old we were on holiday in France. There was á very heavy weather then.
label: fear

text_A: The disease and subsequent death of a close acquaintance. Sadness á was accompanied with feelings of powerlessness (I also á experienced sadness in the situation described under guilt).
label: sadness

text_A: Making bloopers: e.g. telling something negative about a certain á person, while that person is standing besides you and hears á everything.
label: shame

text_A: I wanted to finish a relationship after 3 months. Unfortunately á my friend had a different opinion. I could not answer his á feelings this made him unhappy, and me feel guilty.
label: guilt

text_A: Fear to come and live in Nijmegen.
label: fear

text_A: When the coach of our team degraded me to the second team.
label: anger

text_A: When a friend died.
label: sadness

label: disgust

text_A: When I realised that I had rejected a boy, who was fallen in love á with me, rather bluntly four times.
label: guilt

text_A: Spending the nitht with close friends, after being away (out of á Nijmegen) for a while.
label: joy

text_A: When anybody wants to make me feel guilty. For example: I should á do something for my mother, but things didn't go as she hoped. á Then she threatens: I'll do it myself.
label: anger

text_A: When a close friend took leave of me, because she went to Israel á for one year.

text_A: I wanted to take something from under my bed. While doing this I á felt a dead bird laying under my bed.

text_A: While playing indoor-hockey, there always is an older man who á frequently and intentionally plays the ball out of the field. In á my opinion this is very childish, because we play for fun only.

text_A: Salo, a movie film by Pasolini. People were misused and tortured á for the fun of a few elder Italian authorities, during World War á II.

text_A: I was walking alone in the street late at night (2.30 am). It was á very quiet. Then a man approached me and said \Hello\"."

label: joy

text_A: My parents thought that I didn't do my best to pass the final á examination (secondary school). When I achieved a good grade they á said nothing, but if I had had a bad grade they would have become á very angry.

text_A: When I imitated a teacher behind his back - walking very silly.

text_A: A meeting and a conversation with a woman (somewhat elder than á me) who considers me as her child (she also has one child of her á own). Last two years I lived with her (no relationship).
label: joy

text_A: When talking with my sister, she often ventilates prejudices, á which my father also adheres.
label: anger

text_A: I was in a hopeless situation in a dirty place. No study, no á work, only loneliness.

text_A: It is very difficult to relate it to a certain event. I am á familiar with the disgust of Sartre (la nausTe), a frequently á occurring cause may be described as \the self-assured dullness\"."
label: disgust

label: shame

text_A: In Biarritz (the South of France) I met some English students á who, especially for me, went to Paris and gave me food, while I á didn't have any more money.

text_A: When my father suffered with dizziness. He had to be á hospitalized, because the physician didn't know what was wrong. á Because his stools were black, I thought it could be cancer.

text_A: When I arranged our holiday in Paris, and my girlfriend raised á criticisms all the time.
label: anger

text_A: When a girl in my class (on the secondary school) appeased the á teacher, resulting in getting a higher grade. This occurred often á with her.
label: disgust

text_A: When I arrived too late at a meeting of mentor (the night before á the introduction of novices on the University start).
label: shame

text_A: When my father told me that I should help my mother more often, á because she was so busy. And I realized that he was right.
label: guilt

text_A: Passing an examination, although I felt sure I had failed.

text_A: I lived in a student-house, where you shared the lavatory and á shower with a fellow student. the shower cubicle formed the á connection between both appartments. My neighbour very often was á drunk and aggressive. One night, I was afraid that he would enter á my room.
label: fear

text_A: I suffer form a disease of my muscles. However, I cannot talk á about it and my feelings, the consequence with my parents. They á try to repress it.
label: sadness

text_A: When I failed the grade seven examination.
label: sadness

text_A: When my friend who was drunk insulted me in public for no reason at á all.
label: disgust

text_A: When I was caught with another man's wife.  I had taken the á opportuinty as this man was abroad but he returned that night.
label: guilt

text_A: When I had gone for a boxing tournament which ended at 2 o'clock á in the morning.  I was alone on my way back, and I could hear the á barking of the dogs, the nocturnal animals and the sound of my     á own footsteps.  There had been a rumour  circulating that there á were ghosts in that area.
label: fear

text_A: In 1983 a sadist provoked my sister in my presence.  He tried á to force my sister into accompanying him to his place, but my á sister did not agree and so she was kicked and she fell down.  á There was a fight.
label: anger

text_A: When my father passed away in 1978.  I was left alone with my á mother who was very sick so I had to go and live with my aunt, who á is very short tempered, till my mother was discharged from the á hospital.
label: sadness

text_A: When I learnt that my best friend had failed the exams.
label: disgust

text_A: I was in form five at the boarding school and my friends and I á had gone drinknig beer in the nearby village.  And we were caught á red handed there by a form master.
label: fear

text_A: My elder brother had been expelled from college and he was so á frustated that he attempted suicide - he drank bottle fragments.  á I was very sad when I learnt this.
label: sadness

text_A: It was during a school holiday - I was found necking a girl in my á room by my father.
label: shame

text_A: I was in grade seven and my class was planning a protest against á a rude and immoral teacher.  I sneaked out and told the á headmaster about it and so the plan was foiled.
label: guilt

text_A: I won the first prize at the science fair, the first of the kind á at school and I was only in form II then.
label: joy

text_A: When a close relative of mine passed away, it was the first time á that someone so close to me had died.
label: sadness

text_A: A person whom I thought to be honest took and spend the little á money that I had and I had no way of getting any money in the á few following months.
label: disgust

text_A: While watching a religious film, I got very excited and made a á number of comments which were reproached to me by an elderly á person who respected me.
label: shame

text_A: My 21st birthday celebration, when I cut the cake and received á the presents.
label: joy

text_A: When some seniors tried to scold and insult some juniors on á account of what the juniors were supposed to have said at á secondary school.
label: anger

text_A: When an uncle of mine, who was close to me, passed away after á having had a stroke, before his first daughter could be named.
label: sadness

text_A: When my sister's boyfriend accused her of having been sleeping around.
label: disgust

text_A: When I could not hold my bladder while making a telephone call á and ended up wetting myself.

label: disgust

label: shame

text_A: I have cut loose from my father a few years ago. I know he is á very sad about this.
label: guilt

text_A: I was sexually assaulted one night by a stranger.

text_A: The dying of a close member of the family.
label: sadness

text_A: Seeing maltreated, dead animals.
label: disgust

text_A: A much older man took advantage of me during my childhood (four á to eight years of age).
label: shame

text_A: When I passed a very important exam.
label: joy

text_A: A friend came to visit me late one night. He promised to stay á only a quarter of an hour, but he stayed 5 hours !! He didn't á leave and I was very angry.
label: anger

text_A: During my birthday party a friend drank too much alcohol. So much á that he had to throw up. Worst of all was that he couldn't leave á my friend alone and that he was molesting her.
label: disgust

text_A: I tried to swindle a jeweller because my watch was broken and I á wanted to have it repaired it was a pity but they detected it.
label: shame

text_A: Someone had to do a lot of efforts to make something work. With á my help he would have finished much sooner, but I wasn't in the á mood to help him.
label: guilt

text_A: I went to visit friends and it was very companionable.
label: joy

text_A: I wanted to get in contact with a girl I loved, but I was afraid á she would refuse me.
label: fear

text_A: Disappointed love. The girl made an end to our relationship while á I thought she was in love with me.
label: sadness

text_A: During military service I heard the story of someone who tried to á commit suicide and as a result of this got a week custody.
label: disgust

text_A: I thought of myself as being clumsy when I made love for the á first time with a girl.
label: shame

text_A: A friend of mine had a bicycle-accident because I pulled at his á handlebar.
label: guilt

text_A: Sitting alone in a quiet room, concetrating on things happening á around you. Thoughts come into my mind which make me afraid.
label: fear

text_A: When a teacher tells a story which isn't true. It only reflects á his way of interpreting reality.
label: anger

text_A: I have high expectations for my future but if I pursue the á subject in this manner I will not attain this.
label: sadness

text_A: I heard a broadcasting programme about parapsychology. The people á in this programme used very difficult words which I couldn't á understand. They acted exaggerated without showing any feeling.
label: disgust

text_A: A girl asked me why I didn't dance. I told her I was ashamed to á dance. I felt myself ashamed having to tell her this.
label: shame

text_A: I saved up money for a good purpose. As I also have to organise a á party I am afraid there will rest only a little money for the á good purpose I feel guilty about this.
label: guilt

text_A: My sister and brother in law returned from Sri Lanka where they á adopted a child. I went to pick them up at the airport.
label: joy

text_A: During a football game I made an offence towards an acquaintance. á Later on this acquaintance also tackeled me and the game became á very rude.
label: fear

text_A: I work at a petrol station. When there is a foreigner who wants á petrol my collegues treat him very impolite.
label: anger

text_A: An uncle of mine who just retired, having worked hard all his á life, got a cerebral hemorrhage.
label: sadness

text_A: A student who lives in the same house where I live is an alcoholic. He á tries to manipulate other people with his money when he has drunk á too much.
label: disgust

text_A: When I talked to another student about the notes she got last á semester, not knowing that she got a lot of bad grades.
label: guilt

text_A: When I stayed alone in a house in Great Brittain and there was a á lot of rumour in the newspaper about a murderer still being free.
label: fear

text_A: The stories about the way my grandmother treated my mother.
label: anger

text_A: When my mother was proved to suffer from a very serious disease.
label: sadness

text_A: The stories about my aunt who was beaten and humiliated by my á uncle.
label: disgust

text_A: I omitted to do a favor to a friend, while he was very much in á need for help.
label: shame

text_A: Every year during carnival I am very joyful I have an intense á feeling of happiness then.
label: joy

text_A: I am usually angry at myself. This happens often. For instace á when I want to pet without falling in love and it soon proves á that I have fallen in love with him.
label: anger

text_A: Losing a boyfriend for the second time to my friend. He fell in á love with her. The same thing happened a few months earlier with á another boyfriend.
label: sadness

text_A: There is a person whom I disgust. Evrey time I see her I get this á terrible feeling I disgust her whole appearance.
label: disgust

text_A: When I am angry at someone without a good reason. Later on it á proves that he didn't do anything wrong.
label: shame

text_A: My mother always evokes feelings of guilt in me. For instance á when I miss the last bus I know she will be concerned for me and á stay awake till I arrive.
label: guilt

text_A: When I came again in contact with a girl I liked very much. And á most important she also liked me.
label: joy

text_A: After a hard day at the university I also had to make dinner that á evening. It failed because of a frying pan which broke.
label: anger

text_A: When my father had a cerebral hemorrhage.
label: sadness

text_A: Standing in a crowed shop or in a closed room with too much á people in it. This gives me a fearful experience.
label: fear

text_A: My older brother who gives me unwanted advices about problems in á my relationship with my girlfriend.
label: anger

text_A: My girlfriend left the house in which we lived together a few á months ago. This made me very sad.
label: sadness

text_A: Making an unexpected talk with a professor in the canteen. This á made me shy.
label: shame

text_A: Occurs frequently. A recent experience: when going out with many á friends, nice music, after the examinations, I felt so happy I á could have embraced everybody.
label: joy

text_A: I lived alone in a repulsive area in the city of Rotterdam. I was á annoyed, heard a lot of Burglary and assaults. Especially in the evening á and the night I frequently felt anxious.
label: fear

text_A: Being treated unfairly and being hurt by someone I love.
label: anger

text_A: When coming up for trial because of shop lifting.
label: shame

text_A: Being catched when stealing.
label: guilt

text_A: I fell over head and ears in love with someone who appeared to be á in love with me. it made me so happy that I could hardly sleep á and eat for one week.
label: joy

text_A: One night I had to bike home all alone after a party. Then I á found out that I was pursued by a man in a car.
label: fear

text_A: I had a quarrel with my father, because I was of the opinion that á he decided in an authoritarian way which TV program we should á watch. I became very angry and started throwing things through á the room.
label: anger

text_A: A friend had a quarrel with the mother of her boyfriend because á she and her friend decided to go and live together. She needed á money for removal, then she made a great effort to reconcile.
label: disgust

text_A: I was catched when, as a little girl, I played tricks. I was very á startled then and wet my pants.
label: shame

text_A: I was called and invited to have a talk about a job I wanted to have.
label: joy

text_A: Once late at night (around midnight) a person asked me to give á him a lift. He suddenly tried to attack me but I could escape. á After this he followed me for a little while.
label: fear

text_A: I saw a terrible accident in which the driver of a motor was á thrown through the frontwindow of a car. His face was completely á away.
label: disgust

text_A: Against the will and without the approval of my parents I went á for a few days to my boyfriend in Germany.
label: guilt

text_A: When a friend of me came for an unexpected visit.
label: joy

text_A: When I thought the house was on fire at night.
label: fear

text_A: When the mother of a good friend of mine died.
label: sadness

text_A: I was very angry at someone.
label: shame

text_A: After I saw my family and good friends back after staying one á year in a foreign country.
label: joy

text_A: I was in the library of medical psychology and walked into the á wrong direction. A man who came out of a room threated me very á denigrating and I became very angry in a resisting manner.
label: anger

text_A: A good friend of mine died. During the funeral I felt an intense á feeling of sadness.
label: sadness

text_A: A good friend of mine who is at the moment in a foreign country. á I didn't write her for several months and now I feel guilty.
label: guilt

text_A: When going out I am threatened regularly by two punk-girls.
label: fear

text_A: A friend started to shout at me. He called me an old frump.
label: anger

text_A: My father is someone I disgust. So when he comes close to me á a feeling of disgust overwhelms me. When I stay a week-end at my á parent's place I will remember it for long time.
label: disgust

text_A: After a party in which I made love with a boy in public. Later on á I heard that others were talking about me and called me a slut.
label: shame

text_A: When I got associated with a boy one year ago, I neglected my á best friend. When the relation with this boy finished she behaved á very easy-going towards me. I felt guilty then.
label: guilt

text_A: When I made the winning goal during a very important football á game.
label: joy

text_A: Seeing for the first time pictures about the so called á \treatment\" of Jewish people in Nazi-Germany during World War II."
label: anger

text_A: The death of my mother-in-law after a long sick-bed. at the á moment of dying I was with her.
label: sadness

text_A: I was drinking a glass of wine and eating something when there á suddenly appeared pictures about the famine in some parts of á Africa.
label: shame

text_A: When I don't go to my parents on Sunday and phone them to tell á them that I have to study. The truth is that I listened to sports á on the radio.
label: guilt

text_A: When it appeared that I was not pregnant when I was several weeks á overtime.
label: joy

text_A: The same situation as with sadness. I was afraid about what my á parents would further do to distroy my relationship.
label: fear

text_A: Once again my parents distroyed a relationship.
label: anger

text_A: I had this feeling when my parents distroyed a relationship with á a boy because they thought he was bad and irresponsible.
label: sadness

text_A: After the accident which I described in SHAME. I came to myself á and saw how terrible everything looked like. I disgusted myself á and everything I saw.
label: disgust

text_A: I heard part of a conversation in which one talked very low about á women.
label: disgust

text_A: In an important situation for me, my father behaved inadequately.
label: shame

text_A: When I took the car of someone without saying it to him.
label: guilt

text_A: When a good friend of me told me one evening that she didn't want á to live anymore.
label: fear

text_A: I felt anger when at the end of a telephone call, a good friend á told me that she would go to travel next year with another good á friend. We couldn't talk this out.
label: anger

text_A: I was very sad when I had to leave persons with whom I had a very á intense relationship I also had to leave the environment which á was part of this.
label: sadness

text_A: I made a very insulting remark against a person whom I care for á very much. This event was caused by a third person who didn't á like the person I insulted.
label: shame

text_A: I felt guilt towards my mother when I went to live on rooms in á Nijmegen where I study.
label: guilt

text_A: When my boyfriend and I went out for a dinner and subsequently á went to his family. We had a very nice evening.
label: joy

text_A: When I walk through streets late at night. This is because I and á my friends were attacked one night without any reason for it.
label: fear

text_A: When I got the feeling that I had to do all the housekeeping á while my boyfriend didn't do anything. This happened in a period á of exams when I had to study very hard.
label: anger

text_A: When my best friend got a boyfriend. Because of this a á relationship of ten years was finished abruptely.
label: sadness

text_A: I feel disgust when hearing or seeing other people being treated á inhumanely. For example torturing in chili.
label: disgust

text_A: In my opinion guilt is a feeling which goes together with shame. á Here then I refer to the situation of guilt.
label: shame

text_A: When I became angry at my boyfriend without any reason. I know he á cannot bear me being angry at him and that he can't study anymore á then.
label: guilt

text_A: The day I heard that I passed the high school exam.
label: joy

text_A: I was living in rooms in a very lonely, quiet neigbourhood. á During the night it was very silent and this frightened me. The á fact of being alone in that house frightened me.
label: fear

text_A: A very close friend of mine died. I read it in the newspaper. I á didn't know what to do and thought about it the whole day.
label: sadness

text_A: A girl who also hires a room in the house where I live always á tries to make a quarrel with everyone available she disgusts me.
label: disgust

text_A: A teacher spent a lot of time helping me without wanting to be á paid for it. For the exam I didn't got a good grade and I felt á ashamed.
label: shame

text_A: I knew I had to take an exam very soon but yet I couldn't start á studying. I also knew it was very imprtant to succeed the exam á this time.
label: guilt

text_A: When my gradmother died.  I felt very sad then ... The feeling á started to be worse after a while.
label: sadness

text_A: When I ate a rotten apple.
label: disgust

text_A: When I didn't meet an appointment I had made. The person phoned á me but I thought of something (I told I was ill) so that I didn't á have to go.
label: shame

text_A: When I have to take exams I am very excited and have not much á time for the housekeeping. Then my friend has to do everything.
label: guilt

text_A: My boyfriend was playing with my cat. He was playing games with her á and telling nice things to her.
label: joy

text_A: My boyfriend told me that I had very high demands towards him. In á my opinion this was wrong.
label: anger

text_A: I hadn't been at my parent's place for a long time. When I went to á visit them I had high expectations, but when I was there it was á very different from what I expected.
label: sadness

text_A: During my high school time I succeeded to play a concert of á Mozart on the piano when I gave my first performance I succeeded á to play it very well.
label: joy

text_A: When a car ran into me. The moment that I felt on the street I á thought \This is my end, I am going to die\"."
label: fear

text_A: When our cat was killed in a car-accident I was very angry at the á driver of the car because he didn't take enough care.
label: anger

text_A: There is a boy who I love very much. I asked him to have dinner á with me, but he refused I don't know why he didn't go with me, á but I felt very lonely.
label: sadness

text_A: I saw a dog who was eating excrements.
label: disgust

text_A: During a holiday in East-Germany I got aquainted with a boy who á lived there. We started writing, but I only wrote once. I felt á ashamed because I probably was one of his sparse contacts with á western Europe.
label: guilt

text_A: When people without my permission pry in my belongings and take á things out of it.
label: anger

text_A: Seeing a pornographic movie in which animals were used.
label: disgust

text_A: When I went for the first time in my life to a nudist-beach.
label: shame

text_A: I had an appointment with a good friend. He came 3 hours later á than we agreed upon. During the last hour of waiting I was afraid á something might had happened, because usally he is in time.
label: fear

text_A: I had a quarrel with a good friend about the fact that I didn't á pay her a visit when she expected me to come. Hereafter I was á very sad because it became a real quarrel.
label: sadness

text_A: I was hitch-hiking when a man stopped and gave me a lift to á Nijmegen. During the ride he asked me whether I was in for fun. á The man was fat and tatooed.
label: disgust

text_A: I forgot something I agreed upon with a good friend.
label: shame

text_A: When I was 12 years old I frequently was pursued by others and á got sound thrashes.
label: fear

text_A: When my girlfriend decided to finish our relation.
label: sadness

text_A: When once again I drank too much and felt very rotten the morning á after.
label: disgust

text_A: When I overslept for the second time on the day I had an á examination.
label: shame

text_A: When having a relationship, I made love with another girl.
label: guilt

text_A: When a discussion resulted in an insult, which in my opinion, was á not justified.
label: anger

text_A: When I realized that it did not make much sense to start a á relationship with a girl who was not very constructive to á establish a firm relationship.
label: sadness

text_A: When I had to finish those big amounts of homework in time.
label: disgust

text_A: When I gave water to the plants of a friend. Then one plant fell á over, and a little statue broke. I, of course, had to tell him á everything.
label: shame

text_A: When I had broken a piece of glass of the refrigerator by putting á a hot pan in it.
label: guilt

text_A: On my birthday when several good friends came to visit me.
label: joy

text_A: I felt very lonely, was very dissatisfied with myself when I á realised that I could feel very jealous of other women because á of my boyfriend.
label: sadness

text_A: I felt joyful when my boyfriend met me at the station, while at á first he had said that he would not do that.
label: joy

text_A: I felt very sad when I heard that a friend had committed suicide.
label: sadness

text_A: When I cancelled an appointment with an idle story. Afterwards á it appeared that the person had looked forward to it and reserved á time for it.
label: guilt

text_A: I was testing my new roller skates in the street, suddenly a dog á ran barking in my direction, very threatening. I was very á startled and terribly upset.
label: fear

text_A: Someone told me a story of Amnesty International: a boy was á killed and his head was put in the litter of his girlfriend. It á looked as if she was pregnant, then she died. It is disgusting, I á can hardly write it down.
label: disgust

text_A: I cried for 3 hours because I felt very miserable. Then I called á my boyfriend and he said lovely things to me. After this feeling á disappeared I felt ashamed.
label: shame

text_A: When my boyfriend and I experience something nice or when we have á made a nice walk together.
label: joy

text_A: The weather is very bad (fog and slipperiness) the newcast á reports many traffic accidents and my boyfriend is driving home á and still has 60 kilometers to go.
label: fear

text_A: When people are eating unsavoury (smacking, belching, speaking á with food in their mouth, etc.).
label: disgust

text_A: One night I had a very good conversation with two friends. I then á realized how worthy they were for me and how happy I was to á have them as friends.
label: joy

text_A: When a very close friend with whom I have a very intimate and á bodily relationship (he had a girlfriend) started to avoid me and á didn't want to talk to me any more.
label: anger

text_A: When a good friend with whom I had an intimate relationship made á clear that he didn't want to continue in the same way. He choose á his girlfriend (also a friend of mine).
label: sadness

text_A: My boyfriend suffered form ill health for some months, this week á the physician told him that he was restored to health.
label: joy

text_A: When going out in the weekend I have to bike 5 kilometers through á lonely and dark polders, then I always have terrifying fantasies.
label: fear

text_A: My dear hamster (called Hannes) died at the age of 2 and 1/2 years. á His shape forced me to mercy killing (an injection).
label: sadness

text_A: I read a newspaper report that a little boy was forced to look á while his sister was raped.
label: disgust

text_A: We had made an appointment to complete together a piece of work. á It appeared that I was the only one who hadn't prepared anything.
label: shame

text_A: I had to call someone and make an appointment for a conversation. á I was very afraid to fail.
label: fear

text_A: When, after having cleaned up the kitchen, two hours later I saw á that there was a big mess. It irritated me very much.
label: anger

text_A: One night I was called and told that the father of a close friend á died. When I visited my friend at home and when attending the á funeral I felt very sad.
label: sadness

text_A: Once by coincidence I clutched a stranger (in a rather intimate á way), thinking it was my boyfriend. When by hindsight I á feel ashamed when thinking about it.
label: shame

text_A: I once torn the inner tube of a bike, that was not mine. Then I á saw it was a brand new one. I felt very guilty then.
label: guilt

text_A: My mother unjustly became very angry with me and sent me to my á room while my father explained that the way she saw things was á not correct. I had done things with the best intentions.
label: sadness

text_A: Once after falling in love, I imagined that particular girl to be á perfect and completely overshadowing my girlfriend. Afterwards I á realized that this image was not objective. I felt guilty against á both girls.
label: guilt

text_A: My friend and I planned to search for old documents and utensils á in the cellar. It was very late at night when we arrived in the á cellar. He indicated the place where the police (40 years ago) found á two dead bodies. I got very scared when he told me this story.
label: fear

text_A: When I went up the stairs in a high, dark house full of shadows, á passed a door and had the feeling that someone or something was á behind me, although I knew I was alone.
label: fear

text_A: A friend told me it would be better for me not to be on familiar á terms with another friend, although, in my opinion he had no á reason to say such things. He only said so hoping that I á would search support from him (that, however, was not necessary).
label: anger

text_A: I had a good relationship with two friends. Once without reason, á they clearly showed that they thought I was naive, dull and á unable to take care for myself, while I expostulated that I could á manage things.
label: sadness

text_A: My grandmother several times has been struck by cerebral á hemorrhages. Until now she recovered well each time, but there is á always the threat to loose her.
label: fear

text_A: I was taking a shower in a cubicle in France. Then I discovered á that a few children were loking at me from the adjacent cubicle.
label: shame

text_A: A close relative of mine underwent a difficult operation, and everything á turned out fine.
label: joy

text_A: A class-mate urged me to carry out a particular protest along á with him, and when the time came this fellow drew back while I á had to face the situation.
label: anger

text_A: When I saw someone eating live worms.
label: disgust

text_A: When I was a child my parents caught me with a pornographic á magazine.
label: shame

text_A: When they told me that I had got a study grant.
label: joy

text_A: When I wore a grotesque figure hanging down my back.
label: shame

text_A: When my father was saved from a severe work accident.
label: joy

text_A: When I was a child I hid under the sheets out of fear of á darkness.
label: fear

text_A: When my basket ball team lost the qualification at a final.
label: sadness

text_A: When I see rotten meat.
label: disgust

text_A: When I got to know that I had passed the university entrance á exam.  I thought that I had done one of the exams badly.
label: joy

text_A: When I was very young, one day, I was in the street with my á father and brother.   While my father was talking to some á friends, I saw a dog and began to pat it.  My father told me á sharply to stop doing it because the dog had mange.  Then my á brother told me that I would die and I could not stop crying á after this.
label: fear

text_A: We hitch hiked our way back from a town rather drunk.  We were á dropped in another town which was unknown to us.  I needed to á urinate, so I did it on a wall which turned out to belong to the á military headquarters.  They arrested me and made me pay a fine á of 500 pts.  We had to go home on foot (6 km) since it was too á late for anyone to give us a lift.
label: anger

text_A: I was to meet a girl in a discotheque.  She was very pretty and I á was very happy.  But she did not turn up.  Thank God, there were á some other friends there and I was able to have a more or less á good time.
label: sadness

text_A: I had a class-mate who was rather stupid.  I did not like him á but I respected him.  When he tried to talk to someone, they á would not listen to him and I could not bear seeing this.
label: disgust

text_A: I went to a pub with a group of friends (not very close) and á I was with one girl most of the time, while the other girls in the á group wanted to be with me.  They stopped talking to the girl I á was with.
label: guilt

text_A: Before an exam which I, finally did not take.
label: fear

text_A: At home when they lost three pieces of my puzzle.
label: anger

text_A: When I had an argument with a friend.
label: sadness

text_A: When I am dirty because I have not had a shower for a few days.
label: disgust

text_A: Once I did not have enough money to pay for a coffee.
label: shame

text_A: After an argument with a friend of mine.
label: guilt

text_A: A friend of mine told me that I had passed the entrance exam to á the university.
label: joy

text_A: Before taking an exam.
label: fear

text_A: My family told me to leave if I was not willing to accept the á conditions they imposed on me.
label: anger

text_A: A friend of mine called me when I was not at home.  I phoned her á back to know what she wanted and she told me that she had dialled á the wrong number.
label: sadness

text_A: When my brother was born.
label: joy

text_A: Once I saw some children hunting a cat to death.
label: anger

text_A: The death of a friend.
label: sadness

text_A: When I saw a scene on T.V where a castration was shown.
label: disgust

text_A: Once I answered my father rudely.
label: shame

text_A: When I saw that I had passed the university entrance exam.  It á made me forget all my problems.
label: joy

text_A: When I was ten I got shut in the school with a friend.  I had to á jump out of a window and cross a beam 10 metres high.
label: fear

text_A: When I learnt that a boy I liked had been with a girl for three á years.
label: sadness

text_A: When I realized that I had a hole in my trousers after having gone á for a walk.
label: shame

text_A: When I had an argument with my grandfather the day my younger á brother was born.
label: guilt

text_A: When I saw my 16 year old sister at home after having waited for á her all night, not knowing where she was.
label: joy

text_A: While I was waiting for them to give me the marks of the most á difficult subject this year.
label: fear

text_A: I had an argument with my mother because I criticized the rules á she imposes at home, which are too rigid and arbitrary for me.
label: anger

text_A: On seeing a scene of an accident in a magazine.
label: disgust

text_A: A few days back I had to ask a professor a ridiculous question á because I had lost at a game of cards and had to pay a forfeit.
label: shame

text_A: After several days delay in my girlfriend's menstration I was á very glad to see that the pregnancy test was negative.
label: joy

text_A: I felt angry when I saw on T.V the last slaughter of negroes in á South Africa.
label: anger

text_A: When I failed an exam for which I knew that I had not studied á hard enough.
label: guilt

text_A: During a trivial (friendly) discussion, one of the participants á made an intervention which made me feel uncomfortable.
label: anger

text_A: In a rather important exam, when they caught me red handed á copying.
label: fear

text_A: When my father addressed me directly and maliciously, thus á including me in the \family war\"."
label: anger

text_A: When my parents got divorced.
label: sadness

text_A: When I was a child, one day while playing, I fell up to my waist á in mud.
label: disgust

text_A: When I was with a girl who seemed to love me, while I was with á her just to go to bed with her.
label: guilt

text_A: A murder.
label: anger

text_A: I think that I am rather shy and do not mix with people as I á would have liked to, out of shyness.
label: shame

text_A: When I triffled with other people.
label: guilt

text_A: When I was told that I could take a week off and go for a trip á with my friends.
label: joy

text_A: Every time I went home with my school report.
label: fear

text_A: During an argument between friends, one of them accused me of á taking advantage of some other friends who usually come to the á university in my car, saying that I ask them too much money for á the petrol.
label: anger

text_A: A young man was insulting and humiliating a drunken man.
label: disgust

text_A: I was with a girl one night and then did not call her again, á although she had asked me to do so.
label: guilt

text_A: On a trip to Santander we wanted to stop at a curve because a á friend was sick, and the car skidded of the gravel.
label: fear

text_A: All my friends arranged to go for an afternoon snack and they did á not tell me.  They told me that they did not have my phone number á but I do not think that this was true.
label: sadness

text_A: I was looking after a child and she fell down because I was not á paying her much attention.  One side of her face got bruised.
label: guilt

text_A: During a family discussion on my future and my prospects as a á student, they accused me of not bothering about looking for a job to á assume my financial situation.
label: anger

text_A: [ Depressions.]
label: sadness

text_A: Some of my friends had an argument.  I had earlier phoned one á of them and that may have influenced him to argue.
label: guilt

text_A: When I met a very close friend of mine after one year of á separation.
label: joy

text_A: An argument among several friends because of the irrational á behavior of one of them who fell out with us for no reason and á said that we were to blame.
label: anger

text_A: A class-mate died after being two months in coma, after a car á accident.
label: sadness

text_A: Pictures of Nazi extermination camps on a T.V program.
label: disgust

text_A: Equivocal situation when filling a security questionnaire on á entering a government building with several people there.
label: shame

text_A: I left a boy with whom I was going around without giving him any á explanations.
label: guilt

text_A: When my sister was born.
label: joy

text_A: When they tried to rob me.
label: fear

text_A: When my grandmother died.
label: sadness

text_A: When I see dead dogs on the road.
label: disgust

text_A: When my parents quarelled over something I had done and which was á wrong.
label: guilt

text_A: When my little sister was born.
label: joy

text_A: When I was attending an authorized demonstrationand the police á rushed brutally at the demonstrators, without any warning.
label: fear

text_A: When a professor of this faculty laughed at, and was suspicious of á a composition written by a class-mate and me.
label: anger

text_A: The death of a relative, friend, or someone I esteem.
label: sadness

text_A: When I saw a very disagreable scene.
label: disgust

text_A: When I had to represent my boss at a meeting.
label: shame

text_A: When I inadvertantly made some close friends and relatives feel á bad.
label: guilt

text_A: When I passed an exam.
label: joy

text_A: When they threatened me with a knife to take my money.
label: fear

text_A: When I failed an exam I thought I would pass.
label: anger

text_A: When I saw an accident where the man lost his head.
label: disgust

text_A: When I tripped while getting on a bus.
label: shame

text_A: When I hurt a person's feelings.
label: guilt

text_A: I had not seen my brother for five years as he was not in Spain.   á When he arrived at the airport, I felt great joy.
label: joy

text_A: When a class-mate died.
label: sadness

text_A: When inadvertantly I found myself in the ladies room.
label: shame

text_A: When I broke something and a friend of mine was blamed.
label: guilt

text_A: When I had to walk over three kms through a field which had wild bulls, á because my car had broken down.
label: fear

text_A: When I had to dissect a live mouse at school.
label: disgust

text_A: When I was a child I had to recite a poem in a show at the end of á the term.
label: shame

text_A: When I saw a program on Ethiopia on T.V, a fews hours earlier I á had thrown away some clothes and food.
label: guilt

text_A: When I saw that the mark I had obtained in an exam was a good á one.
label: joy

text_A: We were in the country and I walked away from the others one á night.  Suddenly something moved sharply in front of me and I was á not able to see what it was.
label: fear

text_A: When I was young, I became very angry as I was not allowed to á stay up all night for the fair in my town.
label: anger

text_A: When summer is over and I have to leave the town where I spend my á holidays.
label: sadness

text_A: I was entrusted with an object and while using it I handled it á carelessly and it broke.
label: guilt

text_A: When I learned, after the ecography, that my mother was expecting a á baby girl.  That was what I wanted.
label: joy

text_A: One night, walking along a park, I began to think that some á roughnecks would appear suddenly with knives and things like á that.
label: fear

text_A: I had an exam and I had it well prepared.  I did the first part á very well but did not know the second part.
label: anger

text_A: When my parents did not let me go on a study tour.
label: sadness

text_A: One day I was going through the street door of my house, when a á man asked me for a doctor.  He then showed me his genitals and á asked me to cure him myself.
label: disgust

text_A: Each time the professor asks me a question in class.
label: shame

text_A: I had an argument with my boyfriend.  It was my fault but my á pride would not let me admit it.
label: guilt

text_A: An invitation to spend 5 days at the seaside with all expenses á paid.
label: joy

text_A: When males in my family try to assign house duties exclusively á with referance to sex.
label: anger

text_A: When after a storm in the country, I left my shelter and saw a á big, fat, slimy green toad by my side.
label: disgust

text_A: When a friend from whom I preferred to hide my private life á discovered that I had relations with a man.
label: shame

text_A: When my brother had to spend all evening repairing a gear-lever á that I had broken.
label: guilt

text_A: When I was walking down the street, some boys showed me a knife á and stole all my money.
label: fear

text_A: When they threw my holder down on the floor, with all my notes for á an exam inside it and they got all mixed up.
label: anger

text_A: When my mother was operated.
label: sadness

text_A: One day I got on the bus without any money or season ticket and á the driver threw me out.
label: shame

text_A: When a friend of mine was beaten for what was my fault.
label: guilt

text_A: My father had an operation which lasted for hours.  We were all á very worried but it was successful.
label: joy

text_A: I was walking along a subway when I saw a group of louts.  I was á rather afraid because I was alone.
label: fear

text_A: An old woman was violently thrown down the stairs of the tube by á a group of louts.
label: anger

text_A: A child, 9 years old, died in a stupid way.  He fell from a place á which was 1 metre high.
label: sadness

text_A: On the road there was a dead animal with its entrails showing and á its skull crushed.
label: disgust

text_A: We were discussing a subject ( I knew very little about it) and I á was holding my ground.  They showed me that I was wrong.
label: shame

text_A: I could have passed the last exam of the public competition, but á I failed as I had not studied.
label: guilt

text_A: I phoned two friends and was not able to arrange a meeting with á either of them, so I had to change my plans.
label: sadness

text_A: I had to meet a girlfriend to go out for a drink and she arrived á with her aunt, to whom I was introduced.  Then the aunt left.
label: shame

text_A: One night, after having decided to finish our relationship, I á took my girlfriend home.  While driving back home, I felt that I á had not handled the whole thing very well.
label: guilt

text_A: The begining of my relations with my current girlfriend.
label: joy

text_A: The sight of vomit on the street.
label: disgust

text_A: When I pass an exam.
label: joy

text_A: Continous fear of a nuclear war.
label: fear

text_A: When you kill yourself with work and see the number of slakers á wandering around, doing nothing.
label: anger

text_A: To loose friends because of them over-estimating themselves.
label: disgust

text_A: I thought that I was going to fail a subject and so I began to á study for the final exam, then my friend told me that I had á passed it.  That meant that I could go home, as I do not study in á my hometown.
label: joy

text_A: The man who threw me out of the flat disgusted me.
label: disgust

text_A: I met a girlfriend again after not seeing her for several months. á  I saw her in a discotheque.  We do not like discotheques but we á went there because we knew we would meet there.
label: joy

text_A: My mother was working with a knife and we were all laughing á heartily.  She was not able to control the knife and stuck it á deep into her hand.
label: sadness

text_A: It was about midnight and I wanted to go to the countryside (I á was in town) to watch the stars in the sky.  My mother did not á like this, in spite of it I went out for a while.  My mother got á angry.
label: guilt

text_A: When I knew I had to go out with my mother on some errands.
label: sadness

text_A: One day in class, the professor asked me a question concerning something á he had been explaining.  He was very close to me (beside me) and I á had no idea what to answer.
label: shame

text_A: Once I had some homework to do and I did not do it.
label: guilt

text_A: When they phoned me from Great-Britain to tell me that I could go á there, if I wished, in Summer.
label: joy

text_A: In a very important basket-ball match where a lot was at stake, I á played very badly.
label: anger

text_A: When a friend of mine told me that he was going to commit á suicide.
label: sadness

text_A: A TV program on whale-hunting.
label: disgust

text_A: Once when I said bad things concerning a friend.
label: shame

text_A: Family discord and uneasiness due to something I did not á communicate on time.
label: guilt

text_A: When I passed my driving test, as it was the fifth time that I á had taken this test.
label: joy

text_A: I was given an exam which I thought did not measure at all my á ability or my knowledge of the subject.
label: anger

text_A: Some friends and I were having lunch.  Someone said something á funny and one of the guys started laughing and spat his food in a girl's á face.
label: disgust

text_A: As I was not paying attention, my little brother fell off the á table.
label: guilt

text_A: When I passed the university entrance exam.
label: joy

text_A: One night, while I was sleeping, I woke up suddenly with the á sensation that there was someone in my room.
label: fear

text_A: When they told me that my grandfather was rather ill.
label: sadness

text_A: When I see someone vomitting.
label: disgust

text_A: When I fell head on in a fountain.
label: shame

text_A: I had to undergo an operation in Summer and so my family had to á stay at home during the holidays.  I felt guilty, above all á because of my brothers.
label: guilt

text_A: I had decided to propose to the man I liked to make a trip á together.  One day, during breakfast I told him my idea.  I was á afraid of his not accepting it and that the idea would end up as á a failure.
label: fear

text_A: I was having breakfast with a classmate and suddenly I began to á cry as I thought of a friend of mine whom I had not seen for a á long time.
label: sadness

text_A: When a professor caught me absent-minded and not paying attention á to what he was saying.
label: shame

text_A: One day, I was alone on duty when a patient choked while eating.  á I ran to her and tried to make her breath, but it was too late.
label: guilt

text_A: Once I failed seven subjects at school and I was terrified to á give my report card to my father.  I left it on the table and went to á bed very early in order to avoid him seeing me.
label: fear

text_A: When, after drinking a glass of water, I found a cockroach walking á out of the glass.
label: anger

text_A: I have a very close friend who lives in another city and we have á been writing to each other for a long time.  The last time I went á to her city, just to see her, I was disappointed to see how great á the distance between us was.
label: sadness

text_A: They asked me to throw the rubbish into a dustbin which had some á awful liquid accumulated at the bottom.
label: disgust

text_A: The girl with whom I was going around had been forbidden to be á alone with me in the house.  We paid no attention to this á prohibition but one day her parents appeared and I jumped out of á the window.  They saw me.
label: shame

text_A: I was driving a friend's car, and I got close to the pavement to á ask my way and I struck a parked car.
label: guilt

text_A: I stayed alone in the dark at night in the mountain, waiting for á my uncle.  I remember that I took a big stone and it calmed me.
label: fear

text_A: We were at school, in the room for audiovisual classes.  We were á watching a film, and just behind me two classmates were bothering á me with their mocking and shoves.  I reacted angrily (I suppose)  á by hitting one of them.
label: anger

text_A: [ During a summer holiday a French girl and I had becoe back á home, I felt very sad.]
label: sadness

text_A: Once I had to clean a lavatory which was obstructed.  It was in a á friend's country house and there was nobody there to help me.
label: disgust

text_A: In a Mathematics class, the professor asked me a question and I á gave the wrong answer.
label: shame

text_A: When I lost my study grant without having attended any exam in á the career I had started, and it was too late to cancel my registration.
label: guilt

text_A: When my mother had a nervous illness.
label: fear

text_A: When I had to come back from my village last Christmas.
label: sadness

text_A: One day I went to see a rather disagreeable film (X).
label: disgust

text_A: Once I had to visit a rather special person.
label: shame

text_A: Once, I accidentally injured a boy in the eye and he almost lost á it.
label: guilt

text_A: When I knew the feelings of a beloved person.
label: joy

text_A: A fall during a climb, with almost with no previous experience.
label: fear

text_A: Moving to an unknown place, away from the familiar surroundings á and into a situation of loneliness.
label: sadness

text_A: When I had to sleep in a bed at a hostel, which was full of dirt.
label: disgust

text_A: While shopping, a person close to us created an uncomfortable á situation for those who were with her.
label: shame

text_A: Incomprehension and repression towards a child's behaviour, á commonly not accepted, and making the child cry.
label: guilt

text_A: In a dark street at 4 o'clock in the night and there was á complete silence.
label: fear

text_A: When they broke the artistic work of several weeks.  Changes were á made and it was broken without permission, they had no right to á do this.
label: anger

text_A: When the train taking me to my military service left the station, á on the platform remained relatives, projects and goodtimes.  I á had a hard year ahead.
label: sadness

text_A: A situation of overt unfairness, manipulation of people and its á consequences.
label: disgust

text_A: When a close classmate failed a year.
label: guilt

text_A: I was talking to a friend and he said something which was very á funny.
label: joy

text_A: In a confrontation with a person, he provoked me several times á till I reacted in an angry way.  Fortunately there were no á disastrous consequences.
label: anger

text_A: I was watching a sad film and it affected me deeply.
label: sadness

text_A: When I was reading a book.  It had nothing to do with the book á itself but with the disagreable smell of the pages of the book.
label: disgust

text_A: When I knew that there were, at last, no problems in making a á journey that I had been wanting to make for a long time.
label: joy

text_A: It was more that fear - anguish -that I felt before my last exam.
label: fear

text_A: When I realized that it was impossible for me to be as free as I á had imagined and that I could not do anythong about it.
label: sadness

text_A: The first time I saw a pornographic film, all that in practice is á so beautiful but on the screen appered as something mechanical, á irrational, disgusting and dehumanizing.
label: disgust

text_A: When I do or say something inappropriate which hurts people close á to me.
label: guilt

text_A: When a study tour got confirmed, I was happy all the time till    á the tour began.
label: joy

text_A: When I knew that they would not give me a transfer from one á university to another.  I began to insult the educatioon á authorities and the government, I ended up at the door.
label: anger

text_A: We went to visit my mother at the residence.  She was crying and á said that she was about to die.  I believed all her complaints á and continously thought of the possibility of loosing her.
label: sadness

text_A: My dog had been run over and died near the house.  We had to pick á him up, cold and glassy eyed, to get rid of the corpse.
label: disgust

text_A: A professor was going to read aloud in class a composition of á mine in which I had criticized some political attitudes and also á some class-mates.   I was ashamed at having written that.
label: shame

text_A: When I received my report card in C.O.U.  I was afraid of obtaining á low marks, but they were much higher than expected.
label: joy

text_A: My father began to say incoherant things concerning my brother's and á my own behaviour towards him.  His biased (authoritarian) and á ridiculous point of view made us angry.
label: anger

text_A: I had failed some subjects in mathematics.
label: sadness

text_A: I was at the table at a French friend's house.  They served me a á big dish with roast cauliflower and sauce.  I had to eat it.
label: disgust

text_A: I was alone at home when I broke a figure and then mended it.  A á few days later my mother noticed it and asked me about it, I told á her that I had no idea.
label: guilt

text_A: When I was the target of a great many insults and completely á unfair accusations of a large group of people.
label: anger

text_A: When I entered a brothel and saw two sailors with a young á prostitute who was not older than 18.
label: disgust

text_A: When I was in a religious school my teacher showed me up in front á of all my class-mates.  They were very sarcastic and cruel.
label: shame

text_A: Having suffered a not very pretty sight, I reacted by uttering á some very cruel and sharp words.
label: guilt

text_A: When I came across an old friend whom I had not seen for a very á long time.
label: joy

text_A: I had an accident in which I hurt my eye.  I was afraid of having á injured it badly.
label: fear

text_A: When I was accused of something I had not done.
label: anger

text_A: A close friend died.
label: sadness

text_A: I saw some images of a decapitation in a horror film.
label: disgust

text_A: I made another person cry for an unjustified cause.
label: guilt

text_A: In a bus I fell sick and vomitted in a bag.  The entire situation á was disgusting in itself.
label: disgust

text_A: I rejected a person whom I had always thought to be a friend.  I á told him so and he reacted angrily.  I felt guilty at not having á realized it before and at having hurt him.
label: guilt

text_A: When I received some good news : I obtained an amount of money I á needed to buy something I had been planning to buy.
label: joy

text_A: When my relatives and I were in a car going slowly on a frozen á road.
label: fear

text_A: My parents were having a typical family argument.  I came in and á saw the scene and became angry.
label: anger

text_A: I was going away, leaving a dear person behind.
label: sadness

text_A: At a friend's party there were several allusions to my sexual adventures.
label: shame

text_A: When I talk to my friends.
label: joy

text_A: When I am walking on the streets and see a gang of thugs.
label: fear

text_A: When I am with a friend and we have to leave each other.
label: sadness

text_A: [ Any situation in everyday life has this emotional sense, in á class, in the street, at home, at the table..........]
label: joy

text_A: When I saw in the newspapers, on the T.V, and magazines the á chaotic situation caused by the drought and hunger in á Mauritania.
label: sadness

text_A: The physical appearance of a meal.
label: disgust

text_A: In a situation with my girlfriend I took a decision.  Later when á I thought about it, I realized that it was an erroneous decision.
label: guilt

text_A: One night, at a friend's place I realized that I had everything I á most wished, around me.
label: joy

text_A: When I was young, one day in the car we fell sick and ended up á vomitting on each other.
label: disgust

text_A: The parents of a friend of mine surprised us and another couple á sleeping in thier place.
label: shame

text_A: [ No description.]
label: anger

text_A: When I decided not to out any longer with a girl whom I liked á quite a lot.  This made me feel low for a some time.
label: sadness

text_A: I saw a program on T.V where they had to saw a skull for an        á operation.
label: disgust

text_A: When I used an adjective for a person without knowing what it á meant.   When I got to know the meaning, I felt guilty as it was á a clear and unfair insult.
label: guilt

text_A: When I obtained good marks in a subject I had failed before.
label: joy

text_A: I was with my family and we found some abandoned puppies.  I á wanted to help them but everyone said no.  We then left.
label: anger

text_A: At a concert an old man arrived and began to danse, sing and do á silly things.
label: shame

text_A: I had an argument with a friend of mine.  She would not let me á speak and then I began to shout at her.  She got angry and left, á I did not try to prevent her from leaving.
label: guilt

text_A: We were on the road in a car when a lorry bypassed us.  We had to á swerve and we almost got run over.
label: fear

text_A: I found a big, black spider near a bag of food.
label: disgust

text_A: I had arranged to meet my friends at a certain place, and I was á with other people.  My friends did not arrive and the people who á were with me began to get tired.  My friends were one hour late.
label: guilt

text_A: The man I am going around with gave me a very special present.
label: joy

text_A: I thought that I would be scolded for a comment I had made, which á I should not have made.
label: fear

text_A: At my grandfather's funeral.  I remembered that the thing he á liked and respected most was earth, I thought that he had á attained what he wanted and was not separated from it any longer.
label: sadness

text_A: I had to wash my grandmother because she did not get to the á bathroom on time.
label: disgust

text_A: In a very crowded shop I was distracted and missed my turn in the á queue.  A woman who was behind me began to shout at me asking me á either to pay more attention or to leave.
label: shame

text_A: When I was very young, one day, I kicked my grandmother and á caused her an injury which took a long time to heal.
label: guilt

text_A: When I saw a friend of mine, whom I had not seen for a long time á and I had lost his address and telephone number.
label: joy

text_A: I was in my village when a bull jumped over a fence and started á chasing my friends and me.  We were very frightened till we á climbed up a tree.
label: fear

text_A: I failed a subject despite the fact that I had studied quite a á lot for it.
label: sadness

text_A: When I was walking in a field which had a lot of manure.
label: disgust

text_A: I liked a boy and I would feel shy and then blush.  The more I á wanted to avoid it the more I blushed.
label: shame

text_A: I am not very affectionate and I feel guilty as I do not give as á much affection as I receive.
label: guilt

text_A: I was spending the week-end with some friends.  We were waiting á for another friend and we went to the meet him at the bus stop, a  á woman we met there told us that the coach had already left.  I á was afraid that I would not see my friend, but at last we found á him.
label: joy

text_A: My parents did not let me go on holidays with my friends.
label: anger

text_A: I was told that a friend of mine was going to Mexico for good.
label: sadness

text_A: I was at the University dining room, alone, and at a table next á to mine thre were several professors.  One of them asked me to á join them.  I refused but she insisted.  All the others started á looking at me and I had to move to their table.
label: shame

text_A: I was on holidays, and I was going to meet a friend whom I had á not seen for six months.  Again I felt very happy.
label: joy

text_A: To say goodbye to dear friends after the holidays.
label: sadness

text_A: At the seaside, when a wave suddenly came and took off my bikini.
label: shame

text_A: I gave some personal information to a friend of mine, and he told á it to some others who were implicated in the affair.
label: anger

text_A: There was a cat on the street.  It had been run over and its head was á open.  We passed beside it.
label: disgust

text_A: Last course, when I passed with good marks three subjects which I had á previously failed.
label: joy

text_A: When my nephew was taken to hospital with meningitis and we did á not know what would happen.
label: sadness

text_A: When I went to my boyfriend's house for lunch and saw his á parents, I felt that they were watching me all the time.
label: shame

text_A: We were walking in the park at night.  It was very dark and very á late.  We began to hear foot steps all around us, and we could á not find our way out.
label: fear

text_A: [ One day I arrived home rather tired and found the house..... In á addition I was asked many questions which I did not want to á answer.]
label: anger

text_A: I was selected to do a rest for a foreign ballet but I did not á have the money to do it.
label: sadness

text_A: In a film there was a scene in which a rat was sliding on a bed, á leaving a trace of blood behind, finally it entered the mouth of á one of the actors.
label: disgust

text_A: I was swimming in the river and I lost the top of my bikini.  I á did not notice it and came out of water.  There was a á disagreeable classmate watching the scene.
label: shame

text_A: At a party, several comments were made about the personal á situation of one of the people present.  She was rather affected á and uncomfortable.
label: guilt

text_A: It was Saturday, my duties were over for a few hours and I could á at last be with the people I wanted to see.
label: joy

text_A: One night, I was alone at home.  My fear was caused by some á strange noises which put my imagination to work.
label: fear

text_A: When I got to know about the reaction of a friend of mine in a á certain situation.  I had not expected him to react that way.
label: anger

text_A: I felt alone among a large number of people.  I was sad to see á that nobody cared about what was happening to me.
label: sadness

text_A: I was going to my village, after having been rather oppressed in á Madrid.
label: joy

text_A: I was watching a procession during the Holy week, and a penitent á approached me.
label: fear

text_A: [ No response.]
label: sadness

text_A: Last Summer I achieved someting that I had been wanting for a á long time.
label: joy

text_A: I was in a camp and went out for a walk at night on my own.  I lost  á my way and spent several hours looking for the camp.
label: fear

text_A: [ No response.]
label: sadness

text_A: At the hypocrisy of some of my friends.
label: disgust

text_A: Due to a misunderstanding on my part, two of my best friends á quarelled.
label: guilt

text_A: When we got lost in Florence and the coach did not turn up until á midnight.  I had no place to go to and there were strange reports á at the police station.
label: fear

text_A: When an English teacher unfairly made me repeat a semester which á I thought I had passed.  I had to ask my parents for some more á money to carry on studying.
label: anger

text_A: A friend of mine said in a group that she felt lonely and á withdrawn from everyone because of mental deficiency.
label: guilt

text_A: When I passed the university entrance exam.  I had thus finished á with a difficult period of my life and I was about to begin one á which I had desired a lot.
label: joy

text_A: When I was at home alone, I felt a super-natural force, dangerous á for me and the people close to me.
label: fear

text_A: When I came to know that my father and his parents were : self á interested, dirty, negative, egoist, bad peolpe,......
label: disgust

text_A: On my birthday, when I was given my presents.
label: joy

text_A: When I found one of my new pullovers wrinkled inside the á wardrobe.  My brother had done it.
label: anger

text_A: When I went to see the result of an exam and saw that I had á failed.
label: sadness

text_A: A friend of mine had the sleeves of a leather coat stolen from á his car.  It was me who had left them there for everyone to see.
label: guilt

text_A: The final marks were to be given in the morning.  I wanted to get á there late because I was very afraid.  When I arrived there, á everybody was very happy and I had also passed.  We had a á wonderful time all day long.
label: joy

text_A: I went to visit a friend in hospital.  He was going to be á operated the next day.  I was afraid that they would not let me á in and I did not know what his reaction would be on seeing me.
label: fear

text_A: A friend of mine played a joke on another friend over the á telephone.  This friend, crying, called me and I got very angry á and made the other person apologize.
label: anger

text_A: A friend of mine told me that my boyfriend had been with another á girl this Summer.  We had been going out together for four years á and we had not done so for the last three months.  I could not á believe it.
label: sadness

text_A: I was dancing in a theatre.  I was not sure whether some frieends á of mine had come to see me.  I was very scared of doing things á wrong.
label: shame

text_A: Classes were over and I wanted to go home.  A friend of mine á asked me to wait for half an hour to take him back home.  I said á no.
label: guilt

text_A: Travelling by coach on a rather narrow and wet road.
label: fear

text_A: When I saw an insect going up my arm.
label: disgust

text_A: Arguing with my younger cousin.  She is rather a nuisance but I á felt sorry.
label: guilt

text_A: When some friends of mine asked me to go camping with them for a á fortnight.
label: joy

text_A: Once, when I was very young, my mother left me alone in the á house and came back very late.
label: fear

text_A: When my aunt told me angrily that I was a good-for-nothing and á she was fed up with my behaviour.
label: anger

text_A: When my parents and sister went on a trip and I was separated á from them for about three months.
label: sadness

text_A: When a person I did not know hurt a friend of mine.
label: disgust

text_A: When the literature teacher made me recite a poem in the middle á of the class and I had to gesticulate.
label: shame

text_A: I phoned a friend of mine to ask her for news about the marks in á an exam.  She told me that I had passed.
label: joy

text_A: When I saw a film in which there was a scene where women were cut á to pieces.  Above all, it was the blood and the confusion which á impressed me most.
label: disgust

text_A: A friend of mine trusted me to back her in a decision she had á made.  But when the moment came I did not agree with her opinion.
label: guilt

text_A: I was told that I had passed the statistics exam.  I had not á expected this so I was very happy.
label: joy

text_A: When my brother hit his head and lost consciousness at the sports á practice.  For some time he could not remember what had happened á but he recovered later.
label: fear

text_A: When my grandfather died.
label: sadness

text_A: When I was told that my uncle had passed away.
label: sadness

text_A: The transport to pick us up for lunch was always late and the á driver made the same excuse every day.
label: disgust

text_A: One day when I came back home, I found my favourite dish broken.  á I blamed the servant for it, later I found out that it was not á the servant but my daughter who had broken it.
label: shame

text_A: When I did not give back a text book to a friend in time.
label: guilt

text_A: When a man who had a knife grabbed me and threatened me with it,   á during my holidays in Monze.á
label: fear

text_A: A certain friend tried to push me off a seat in a very violent á way for no apparent reason.  It may be that he was excited about á something.
label: anger

text_A: When the neighbour of a friend of mine was stabbed to death by á thieves in Kabwe.  They stole his van.
label: sadness

text_A: When I blamed my niece for misplacing my book, she denied having á touched or seen it but I carried on insisting that it was her.
label: guilt

text_A: When I was about six years old, I mistook a cat for a leopard      á when it entered my room at night.
label: fear

text_A: When I lost my father on the 25th of September,1970.  He died of á a sore on the leg.
label: sadness

text_A: When they found out that I was absent from school, I had gone to á the girl's secondary school.
label: guilt

text_A: When I first passed a job interview.
label: joy

text_A: I was almost caught in the girls hostel by the security men, I á would have been expelled from school had I been caught.
label: fear

text_A: I got pass marks in the H.S.S compulsory courses while most á people performed well.
label: shame

text_A: I destroyed my step-brother's bedsheets by mistake, they were the á only ones he had.
label: guilt

text_A: When I heard that I had made it to the second year at UNZA.
label: joy

text_A: When my father's home was to be broken into by thieves who had á guns.
label: fear

text_A: When a friend tried to back bite me on false grounds.  This made á me wonder if he was a really a good friend.
label: anger

text_A: When someone whom I trusted, disappointed me terribly.
label: disgust

text_A: When I lied to my mum, who later came to know that what I had á been teling her was false.
label: guilt

text_A: When I hooked a girl in Kitwe.  She was very beautiful for my á standards, a rare bird of this kind accepted me as a boyfriend.
label: joy

text_A: When someone tried to bewitch me and my friends at night.
label: fear

text_A: When I was victimized for running away with a girl who was á somebody else's wife and niece at the same time.  I was very á angry over this issue because I was told to pay him money after á having been punished for it.
label: anger

text_A: 1976, Soweto uprising in South Africa and the racist Gout's á reaction to the students demands concerning the educational á system.
label: sadness

text_A: When I was found urinating, behind a toilet instead of inside it, á by my class mates and the teachers.  I was told to pick up my own á urine from the wet soil, I did it.
label: shame

text_A: When my uncle found me having sexual intercourse with a distant á relative of mine in the sitting room, on the couch.  I failed to á stop and get up, I carried on.
label: guilt

text_A: When I was accepted for further education, here at the á university.
label: joy

text_A: When I was walking at night, I saw fire suspended in the air and á it was split into several segments by something I could not see.  á I suspected that it was witch-craft.
label: fear

text_A: When I received a message that my brother was seriously ill and á was in hospital.
label: sadness

text_A: When I was refused a transfer from my school to another, simply á because it was far away from my house.
label: disgust

text_A: When I was caught stealing mangoes in a certain compound.
label: guilt

text_A: When I got first division in the exams before leaving school.
label: joy

text_A: When I went to town in a double dekker bus.  The bus was about to á fall on the way when the driver controlled it.  It had almost á fallen.
label: fear

text_A: When I was in form 3, my aunts lied to my daddy telling him that á I had told them that I was pregnant.  My daddy  told my mother á and she asked me if it was true.  I was very angry with my aunts.
label: anger

text_A: When a drunkard, in town yelled at me saying that I was a á prostitute.
label: disgust

text_A: My brother came to see me and found me with a boy friend.  When á my boyfriend greeted him, he did not answer and instead started á shouting at me and scolding me in the prescence of my boyfriend.
label: shame

text_A: When I had my four children.
label: joy

text_A: When two of my children were critically ill with measles.
label: fear

text_A: When I got a low grade in an administration course.
label: anger

text_A: When I got divorced from my husband after ten years of marriage.
label: sadness

text_A: When my mother betrayed me by obtaining money from my husband á when we were separated - pending divorce.
label: disgust

text_A: When I woke up at night to find a fire spreading towards the bed á -rooms.  I was very frightened as I realized that I faced death.
label: fear

text_A: I experienced this emotion when my friend committed suicide after á we had spent the afternoon playing and discussing life and it's á problems.
label: sadness

text_A: When I got drunk at a party and made a fool of myself by á vomitting all over the place and insulting the people who were á there with me.
label: shame

text_A: When I was caught sneaking back into the house at night after á having  gone to a disco without permission.
label: guilt

text_A: When I was told that I had passed the exams.
label: joy

text_A: When my sister broke my china tea set.
label: anger

text_A: I felt very sad when my son died after a short illness.
label: sadness

text_A: When I failed to answer a simple question.
label: shame

text_A: When I learnt that I was selected for form I.
label: joy

text_A: When I was nearly beaten up by the brother of my girlfriend.
label: fear

text_A: When a friend, who has been with me at school, failed to make it á to UNZA.
label: sadness

text_A: When my girlfriend told me that she was no longer interested in á me.
label: disgust

text_A: I choked on a cold drink in front of girls who were strangers.
label: shame

text_A: When I was caught with my girlfriend in the house at night.
label: guilt

text_A: When I passed the grade 7 exam.
label: joy

text_A: When I was told by the doctor, after many months of coughing, á that I had tuberculosis.
label: fear

text_A: When a cousin of mine took my bottle of T.B tablets, put water in á it and threw it in the dust-bin.
label: anger

text_A: This happened when one of my uncles died just whan I was á planning to go and visit him during the next holidays.
label: sadness

text_A: When I realized that my closest friend had said bad things about á me when I was not around and had betrayed me by making friends á with my boyfriend's other girl.
label: disgust

text_A: When my mother returned from a holiday, I told her a lie i.e my á father had brought another woman home while she was away.
label: guilt

text_A: When I was mistakenly accused of being a thief when I accidently á gave a fake coin at a counter.  I realized this before I handed á over the coin, but the man called me a thief and called a á witness.
label: anger

text_A: The day I was forced to use a public convenience place in town.  á It was so filthy that it really made me sick.
label: disgust

text_A: My mother caught me stealing some food when I was a young á boy.
label: shame

text_A: When I gave in to what my wife wanted and locked the cat out, it á was killed by the dogs.
label: guilt

text_A: I felt joy when I came to know Christ.  That is when I became a á Christian.
label: joy

text_A: When I heard that my nephew had passed away.
label: sadness

text_A: When I stole a book in class and the teacher caught me, the rest á of the class laughed at my attempt.
label: shame

text_A: When I insulted an elderly person for no reason.
label: guilt

text_A: When a lady I was flirting with told all my class-mates that she á was in second year while I was in first year, everyone laughed á and started looking at me.
label: shame

text_A: My cousin knocked on the door, looking for me to get her watch á back.  I had given it to my girlfriend, Lizzy, as a present.
label: guilt

text_A: This was when the girl I was in love with accepted my proposal á and everything went smoothly, just as I had wanted it to.  It was á contrary to my previous feelings of uncertainty about her á response.
label: joy

text_A: It was when I dreamt that I had encountered Satan, he wanted to grab me á and take me to his kingdom.  He was very repulsive and I have á never seen anything like that before.
label: fear

text_A: This was when I found out that a cousin of mine had taken away my á trousers without my consent.
label: anger

text_A: When I failed a test at my primary school.  I was then in grade 7 á and we were about to take the main exam.
label: sadness

text_A: This was when I saw, for the first time, a naked woman á (prostitute) run away from a house after having been discovered á by the guardian.
label: disgust

text_A: When I was afraid to tell my sports teacher at secondary school á that I had not participated in the sports activities the previous á day.
label: guilt

text_A: I was in grade 7.  We had an inter-house volley-ball competition. á  In Luapula I was the youngest member of the team and I scored  á the winning goal using my head.  I jumped up with joy and fell á down.
label: joy

text_A: I was escorting a relative on a bike, we passed by a dark road á with bushas on each side.  Half way down this road, suddenly, we   á saw a white dog appear from one side.  Before we could do á anything, it had vanished and moreover it did not seem to have á any legs.
label: fear
