text_A: Riding home from school after completing two midterms in two á days, and feeling I did well on them.
label: joy

text_A: Occured while preparing for a midterm in Social Welfare that I á thought was going to be very hard and felt unprepared for.
label: fear

text_A: Caught lying to my father about a speeding ticket I had received.
label: shame

text_A: Getting a friend an open container ticket because I got caught á speeding.
label: guilt

text_A: Before I moved away from home, I feared leaving.
label: fear

text_A: I felt sadness when my grandfather died.
label: sadness

text_A: This person I know lied about how much income his parents made á and received money through grants which he did not need. Another á person is barely making it, did not lie, and did not receive á enough money.
label: disgust

text_A: After a big fight with my parents.
label: shame

text_A: I forgot about a close relatives's birthday.
label: guilt

text_A: On my birthday, my closest friends were here at Berkeley pithched á in a lot of money each and bought me ten records to replace some á of my records that were stolen. They threw a small surprise party á for me too.
label: joy

text_A: While skiing in Squaw Valley, I was riding up a chair lift and á right when the chair was above a sheer cliff of rocks, the chair á lift stopped and all the chairs sagged and everything seemed to á creak loudly.
label: fear

text_A: I read in the newspaper about a 21 yr. old woman who was found á naked and dead along a roadside. It turned out she had had two á relatives 14 and 19 who were kidnapped, raped and killed earlier.
label: disgust

text_A: I went to bed with a girl and the next day she thought it was the á start of something serious and I just thought it was fun and I á told her I wasn't interested in starting a serious relationship.
label: shame

text_A: I dreamed that this girl and I were cuddling in bed when my á girlfriend walked in. I really love my girlfriend so I felt á guilty and sad. I know that this is a wierd example but the dream á and the feeling was clear to me as if it had really happened.
label: guilt

text_A: A co-worker and I had to rush a project. I was only working there á for one month and he for some years. Instead of letting me know á that he wanted to do the project himself, he went to the á superviser and let the superviser tell me to let the co-worker do á it himself since he was quicker at it.
label: anger

text_A: Losing a pet chick. Our family had just put the chick outside a á few days before and then one morning it was gone.
label: sadness

text_A: NO RESPONSE
label: shame

text_A: Two summers ago my best friend and I drove into unknown mountains á at midnight to pick up my broken car. We told one another á horrifically scary ghost/murder stories and succeeded in scaring á eachother pretty well - even though somewhere in our heads we á knew the fears were unjustified.
label: fear

text_A: I had just seen my pseudo-girlfriend and our conversation angered á me greatly.
label: anger

text_A: When one individual takes advantage of and/or injures another á relatively defenseless individual, consciously. I feel disgust á mingled with anger. A person on my dorm floor verbally assaulted á another person for having a certain religious belief.
label: disgust

text_A: I borrowed $ 20.00 from a friend and paid him back much later á than I had originally intended.
label: shame

text_A: One of my good friends told people something I had told her á in confidence about someone else.
label: disgust

text_A: Football was a very big deal at my high school, so I was joyous á when my school's team won the conference championship last year.
label: joy

text_A: I was driving on to a busy freeway during rush hour and it was á slightly raining. A diesel truck was coming very close behind me á and I was close behind a pick-up. I changed lanes and barely hit á the truck and ran a Honda of the road. I was scared to death to á go back and see if I caused him to crash.
label: fear

text_A: I vividly remember having feelings of disgust toward some of my á jr. high classmates who didn't work at all on their schoolwork á and who would coplain and take my tax money when I was older and á more successful than they were. At the time I pictured some á adults like this that I knew in the complaining situation.
label: disgust

text_A: I could have died when I was caught cheating on a test in high á school. That was my first and last time.
label: shame

text_A: When I didn't study for tests in High School. In particular  á remember a physics test. I didn't study because my friends talked á me out of it and we did something else boring. I felt so helpless á just being there - then guilt set in because I was very close to á getting an A in the class.
label: guilt

text_A: When  first came to CAL I went to a rally on Sproul and I later á learned that the rally was conducted by the Moonie cult. They á were taking pictures at the rally, so I was afraid that they á would circulate the pictures and then kidnap people. I did not á know how the cult worked. I was scared.
label: fear

text_A: I ran a race for the CAL track team and I did terribly and then á the coach said that I should sit out for the season. I felt á really sad because I wasn't going to be able to run. It was á something I always had done and now I couldn't do it anymore.
label: sadness

text_A: When I saw a girl in my economics discussion section smiling and á asking stupid questions to the TA. just to get attention. She was á obviously ass-kissing. It happens in every Econ. discussion held á weekly.
label: disgust

text_A: I went to go get a bike innertube fixed. I fixed it and I was á supposed to pay previously but I didn't. I said I would after I á fixed the tire. After fixing the tire, the salesperson who helped á me was gone so I walked out of the store without paying. I felt á guilty so I went inside and paid for the tire.
label: guilt

text_A: I feared that my dog's eye was infected too much. He had played á around in the weeds and a foxtail had gotten under his eyelid. I á took him to the vet and I feared that he may go blind because of á the foxtail.
label: fear

text_A: One of my friends kept criticizing me about everything I did. I á thought she was kidding, but later I found out that she was á serious.
label: anger

text_A: I felt disgusted when I found out that someone had betrayed me. á That person had been dishonest with me and I felt used.
label: disgust

text_A: After taking a difficult midterm for one of my classes, I felt á shame for not studying as much as I should have. I was ashamed of á the results of the midterm.
label: shame

text_A: A close friend of mine was leaving for graduate school out of á state. I had arranged to gather some people together the day á before he left to be with him and have a good time, but I didn't á pay as much attention to him as I should have.
label: guilt

text_A: I spoke with a friend on the phone who I haven't seen in many á years. It was a joyful event to talk to him.
label: joy

text_A: I was on this amusement park ride at Marriots Great America. It á went way up in the air and then around and around. Heights are á not my favorite spots in life.
label: fear

text_A: I typed up a letter for this physician at work. She didn't care á for my style, even though she was not using correct English. I á told her it was her letter and we would do it her way.
label: anger

text_A: I was disgusted at the behavior of these boys I work with in the á scouting program. They showed a lack of interest, unrest, and at á times just plain rude behavior.
label: disgust

text_A: I had a test in the class and I had not adequately prepared á myself. I didn't fare so well on the exam and I felt bad about á it.
label: shame

text_A: I was supposed to have done some things for my mother, but just á plain didn't get around to it.
label: guilt

text_A: My friends and I were sitting at a restaurant. We were talking á and a few of them said awful things about women. I became á disgusted by their narrow-mindedness.
label: disgust

text_A: When I got accepted to CAL.
label: joy

text_A: My apartment has had three robberies in the last month. The guy á upstairs just got robbed making it the fourth.
label: fear

text_A: When my roommate's boyfriend assaulted me. He was threatening me, á calling me names and pushing me around.
label: anger

text_A: I was going to go on a vacation to Texas this summer but was á unable to go because of registration.
label: sadness

text_A: I didn't do very well on a midterm and I'm disgusted with myself á because I was prepared and thought I did well.
label: disgust

text_A: When I dated my friend's boyfriend after they had broken up.
label: shame

text_A: A friend was going to come stay the weekend with me, but á something came up and I cancelled out on him.
label: guilt

text_A: When someone tried to rape one of my best friends and he claimed á it was her fault. He the hassled her, claimed she was loose, and á threatened to sue her.
label: anger

text_A: My mother kicked my surrogate father out and he in turn did not á care for the dog, Afthur, he bought for the family. His lack of á concern lead tho Arthur's death on the freeway. I loved Arthur á like a brother. He was easy to talk to.
label: sadness

text_A: The fact that I was pregnant. I was always considered level á headed and did not have sex until 18 and out of high school.
label: shame

text_A: When I walked to church with my roommate, a bum told us to call á the police and he started following us.
label: fear

text_A: The same for guilt would apply.
label: shame

text_A: I added a little   ?   to a yield in an experiment to get more of á a yield.
label: guilt

text_A: Third highest grade in the class and the best answer given for á one question (the question was graded by the professor and he á indicated he liked my answer).
label: joy

text_A: In the recent lightning storm, bolts of lightning were hitting á close by (1/8 mile). I was in bed at the time and was afraid I á might be struck.
label: fear

text_A: I attended a ceremony in Denmark which is comparable to our á Halloween. They build a large bonfire and place a life size dummy á of a witch. The crowd cheered when the dummy burst into flames.
label: disgust

text_A: I came home from school very keyed up. At the dinner table I á unfortunately unloaded a lot of my hostility off on one of my á parents. I'm ashamed that I didn't dispate and control these á feelings before coming to the table or even let the energy build á up in the first place.
label: shame

text_A: After watching the 49ers lose game after game, year after year, I á was finally rewarded with a Super Bowl victory which made me á extremely happy.
label: joy

text_A: While swimming, I hit my head at the bottom of the pool and á required stitches. I later learned that the consequences could á have been much more severe and that terrified me.
label: fear

text_A: I was rushing home from school because there was a 49er game that á night. I got into a non-injury accident, which was all my fault, á but destroyed the front of my car. The truck I hit was undamaged.
label: anger

text_A: When I learned that my dad had cancer. I knew he was going to the á hospital for some tests. My mom told me when she picked me up one á weekend from CAL to take me home.
label: sadness

text_A: Now that the 49ers are winners, the fans are coming out of the á woodwork and jumping on the bandwagon and that disgusts me.
label: disgust

text_A: I felt fear when I was young and left in my big house all alone.
label: fear

text_A: I felt sad when my boyfriend and I were apart for some time.
label: sadness

text_A: I felt ashamed when I was confronted by a teaching assistant that á a close friend and I were accused of cheating on a math exam.
label: shame

text_A: After much trouble getting together in the first place my á boyfriend and I celebrated our first anniversary.
label: joy

text_A: Since I moved into the dorms and I've been spending most of my á free time with my boyfriend. I hardly see my old high school á friends. I had several bad incidents with my 2 past best friends.
label: sadness

text_A: I took a psych. experiment with a totally unappealing gay man as á the experimentor, some homosexuals are funny or cute, but this á guy was disgusting. Plus the experiment was about gays too.
label: disgust

text_A: I've had three midterms in the past two weeks and I hardly á studied for any of them (like 1 or 2 days) I feel guilty that I á hadn't studied and I got C's on all of them.
label: guilt

text_A: Winning a close volleyball game. (I'm on the intercollegiate team á at CAL)
label: joy

text_A: When a close friend drowned in the American River.
label: sadness

text_A: Arguing with a friend over politics. She was more informed on the á issues and made me feel very ashamed of my political ignorance.
label: shame

text_A: Getting sent on a company expense trip to another state to work á for a week at that plan.
label: joy

text_A: On my second plane trip, we ran into unexpected turbulence.
label: fear

text_A: Having my personal objects rearranged by someone else without my á consent and having it arranged to their taste. Then trying to á find a particular object they rearranged for an hour or more.
label: anger

text_A: Death of my father.
label: sadness

text_A: Getting back my math midterm, I received a lower grade than I á thought I would get. After going through the questions I felt á that the grader had graded harshly and I had made only a few ? á errors.
label: disgust

text_A: Getting a low grade on a midterm.
label: shame

text_A: Promising to do a task for a friend and just forgetting about it.
label: guilt

text_A: When I finished my C.S. Project I was overjoyed. I felt relieved á because it was due the next day and I was tired of looking at it.
label: joy

text_A: I overturned in a canoe a few years back and I didn't know how to á swim. Although I had a life-jacket on I still panicked.
label: fear

text_A: When I saw a wino by some cans with Food Stamps and use the á change to buy wine.
label: disgust

text_A: After yelling at my girlfriend, I felt bad because she was ? á crying and upset.
label: guilt

text_A: A party with no worries (i.e. no tests homework etc.) many á friends were present and good music.
label: joy

text_A: After blowing up and saying all the wrong things, I realized what á I had done and hurt that person and myself.
label: sadness

text_A: My friends aren't working for the same common goal we all need to á accomplish.
label: disgust

text_A: I was supposed to do something and didn't. The person was really á dependiong on me.
label: shame

text_A: After confronting the person who stood me up, I blew up and said á all the wrong things.
label: guilt

text_A: I realized the girl liked to be with me.
label: joy

text_A: That I would do bad in a class and not get into Bus school.
label: fear

text_A: When my dad told me about something he had done against my á mother.
label: anger

text_A: When I heard my sister got in a bad car accident.
label: sadness

text_A: An Engineer I know wants war so he can get a job making bombs.
label: disgust

text_A: I did bad on a test I didn't study for.
label: shame

text_A: Decided at the last minute not to do something that I said I á would do with a person.
label: guilt

text_A: When I passed the B.A exams with first class results.
label: joy

text_A: When my B.A results had not come.
label: fear

text_A: When my sister left home to go and live with her husband.
label: sadness

text_A: I trusted a friend of mine, but she lied to me about something á and this disgusted me.
label: disgust

text_A: When I failed the S.S.C examination I felt very ashamed.
label: shame

text_A: [ I felt guilt when I was not co-operative with my mother for my á exam.]
label: guilt

text_A: My first feeling of falling in love.  Coming across a person who á made me feel love, happiness, joy, giving me a new and beautiful á future, who made me dream.
label: joy

text_A: When I got to know that the friend I am closest to got engaged, á and she was going away.  I was overjoyed for her, but also felt á frightened as I was very emotionally dependent on her.  I did not á know what I would do without her.
label: fear

text_A: I felt disgusted while studying for my applied psychology and á mental testing papers in B.A.
label: disgust

text_A: I felt guilty when I lied to my parents.
label: guilt

text_A: A few weeks back my daughter had very high fever and I was scared á that it might lead to brain damage or convulsions.
label: fear

text_A: I felt angry when my mother-in-law did not handle my daughter á properly and she fell down from the bed and hurt her head.
label: anger

text_A: I was very sad when I could not take the M.A (I) exams due to á illness, and a relative of mine disheartened me about it.
label: sadness

text_A: When the teacher asked me a question in class, concerning á something I had read earlier, and I did not know the answer, so I á felt ashamed in front of the whole class.
label: shame

text_A: When my family allowed me to do higher studies.
label: joy

text_A: When I decided to separate from my husband.
label: fear

text_A: [ When my elders do not understand me in the right way.]
label: sadness

text_A: When my husband quarrelled with me for no reason at all.
label: disgust

text_A: [ I have never felt this emotion.]
label: shame

text_A: [ I have never felt this emotion.]
label: guilt

text_A: I went for a walk on the beach with a friend whom I had not seen á for many months.  The weather was very pleasant, we had some á ice-cream and lots of fun on the beach.
label: joy

text_A: That day I was alone at home after coming home from school.  I did á not know where everyone else had gone, I kept waiting for them to á come back and nobody came.  It was getting very late and I was á terrified.
label: fear

text_A: I was walking on a street alone in the afternoon when there were á not too many people on the street.  A couple of guys were á following me and I was ignoring them.  Suddenly one of them came á in front of me and started using dirty language and harrassing á me.  I got very angry and wanted to strike back at them.
label: anger

text_A: A close friend of mine was to get married in a weeks time when á her father died of a heart-attack.  I knew him well and felt bad á on hearing of his death.
label: sadness

text_A: I had gone to the hospital for my research and got late in á reaching home.  I feared that when I reached home there would be á a quarrel because of my being late.
label: fear

text_A: [ I feel angry when somebody is unjust to me.]
label: anger

text_A: [ I feel sad when somebody is unjust to me.]
label: sadness

text_A: [ I have never felt this emotion.]
label: shame

text_A: When I went for a picnic in Lonavala, I felt full of joy.
label: joy

text_A: When I missed my train this morning, I felt sad for some time.
label: sadness

text_A: When I had exams a relative of ours, who lives in another city,á came to visit us and I felt disgusted at him.
label: disgust

text_A: I felt ashamed when I had not attended a class and the teacher asked á me the reason for my absence.
label: shame

text_A: I acted in an English play in college and got the Best Actress á award, while our play got the first place.
label: joy

text_A: I was to meet a friend at the bus-stop (he was coming to visit á us) and he did not turn up.  After having waited for him for some time     á (about an hour) I called him up, to be told that he did not á intend to come as he was feeling tired.
label: anger

text_A: When my sister died in a fire accident at home.
label: sadness

text_A: When my husband told me about his pre-marital affairs.
label: disgust

text_A: When I failed the ninth standard exam in school.
label: shame

text_A: When I passsed the M.S.C board exams with first class, which I á had not expected.
label: joy

text_A: [ I have always been very scared and tense before an exam and á before the declaration of the results.]
label: fear

text_A: [ When someone tells me something that hurts me, I feel bad about á it and also feel sad.]
label: sadness

text_A: I felt guilty when I lied to my parents.
label: guilt

text_A: I was very happy when I passed the B.A with first class marks.
label: joy

text_A: While trying to board a train I missed the footsteps and fell á down on the platform.
label: fear

text_A: I was having an argument with my brother on his behavior, then we  á started fighting and I got annoyed at him because he started á teasing me.
label: anger

text_A: My best friend got married and left her home-town to go and live á in Poona.  After her wedding I felt sad.
label: sadness

text_A: I feel disgust at my neighbour, because she comes to our house with á her child, who spoils our furniture.
label: disgust

text_A: When I failed the twelveth standard exams I was ashamed at á having to see my parents later.
label: shame

text_A: When my mother scolded me and I argued with her.
label: guilt

text_A: When I passed the B.A exams with first class results.
label: joy

text_A: When I failed the M.S.C exams.
label: anger

text_A: When my father was ill.
label: sadness

text_A: When my friend who is close to me got engaged and did not invite á me.
label: disgust

text_A: When I fought with my friends.
label: guilt

text_A: Last year I passed the B.A exams in Psychology in which I stood first á in my class.  Thus I got the first prize from the college.  I was á most happy to tell all this to my parents and friends.
label: joy

text_A: When I was 20 years old, I fell severely ill and was bed-ridden for á 6 months.  I felt very scared for my health and my studies.
label: fear

text_A: A few months ago when I was teaching, I suddenly became very á angry at the children and slapped some of them.
label: anger

text_A: My friend got married and went abroad, this made me feel sad and á lonely.
label: sadness

text_A: When a begggar approached me for money, I felt disgusted.
label: disgust

text_A: When I got 1/2 out of 15 in Abnormal Psychology I felt ashamed.
label: shame

text_A: When I got a first class in the twelveth standard exams, I was very á surprised and happy and I had a very good time with my friends.
label: joy

text_A: I had a very horrible dream one night, I dreamt that I had fallen á off a very crowded train.
label: fear

text_A: When I was at S.Y.Bajaj I wanted to get admission in another á college and this was not easy and I felt angry.
label: anger

text_A: When my mother scolded me for something, very insignificant, without á knowing the real cause of what had happened.
label: sadness

text_A: I feel disgusted at my cousin, who is bad-mannered, does not know á how to behave and talk to others, he does not respect elders and á lies all the time.
label: disgust

text_A: One day in the TYBA class the teacher asked me a very simple á question which I could not answer.  Finally the teacher himself á gave us the answer and my friends started laughing at me as I had á not been able to answer a simple question.  I knew the answer but á feared that my response may be wrong.  All this made me feel á ashamed of myself.
label: shame

text_A: It so happened that while staying at anaunt's place I discovered á that I was afraid of sleeping in pitch darkness.  The room á which my sister and I were sharing had no light, and I would á refuse to sleep without having the light of the adjoining á bathroom switched on.
label: fear

text_A: When some of my close friends and colleagues talk about me and á my work and say that I am the brightest student of the college.
label: shame

text_A: In some special circumstances l lied to my parents, then felt á guilty so I told them the truth and felt free.
label: guilt

text_A: One of my friends asked me to go shopping with her, another á friend of hers was also coming along.  During the outing they á kept talking to each other and I felt left out, even when I tried á to talk to them they seemed not to listen to me and did not pay á me much attention.
label: anger

text_A: Two years ago my best friend died in an accident, just a day á before my birthray.  We were very close to each other and I felt á very sad at loosing a close friend.
label: sadness

text_A: We had gone to our native village and I went to visit a tribal á group which believes in Goddess Kali.  As it was a festival day they á had to offer a hen to the Goddess so they cut the head off a hen á right in front of my eyes.  I felt disgusted and evenb gave up á eating meat after this incident.
label: disgust

text_A: One day I went to see a movie without my parents permission.  It á was an adult movie and I was scared that my parents would not á allow me to see the movie.  However after coming home I felt very á guilty at what I had done.
label: guilt

text_A: I was in a garden one evening and I saw a snake coming towards á me.
label: fear

text_A: I am separated from my husband.  The way he has behaved towards á me makes me angry.
label: anger

text_A: When my husband lied to me, tricked me and when I had to leave my á home.
label: sadness

text_A: The way my husband and his family treated me - unfairly, cruelly, á and unjustly.
label: disgust

text_A: While having an argument with my daughter, I got angry and á over-excited and said angry words.
label: guilt

text_A: When I got married.
label: joy

text_A: My husband falls ill and does not follow the doctor's advice on á the treatment or the diet control.
label: disgust

text_A: When I could neither measure up to the expectations of the teacher á nor to my own expectations in one of the assignments.
label: guilt

text_A: The day I got married was the happiest day of my life.  Both of á us felt that we were right for each other in every way and we had á no doubts about our compatibility right from the day we got á engaged.
label: joy

text_A: When I could not pass my exams with good marks.  My wedding was á to take place 15 days after the exams and I tried to convince á myself that this was the reason for my not having done well.   á However, I thought that had I really put my mind to doing well at á the exams I would have done well.
label: shame

text_A: When I succeeded in achieving a scholarship for which I had á strived hard during a period of financial, personal and physical á stress.
label: joy

text_A: I put in two years of hard work and it was neither looked at nor á appreciated.
label: sadness

text_A: Despite my being affectionate, sincere, and helpful to close  á relatives of mine; they turned around and accused me of being á inconsiderate in my relationship with them.
label: disgust

text_A: I could not take care of my mother when she was admitted to a hospital  á for surgery, I continued my studies as I could not get leave.
label: guilt

text_A: I was coming home from a relative's place and it was about á 9.30/10 P.M.  I felt slightly apprehensive when I got off the bus á and started walking towards my place.  I was confident that á nothing would happen to me, yet there was this slight feeling of á fear.
label: fear

text_A: When we complained about the uncleanliness of the work place, the á authorities agreed to have the place cleaned.  Even after 2-3 á days nothing had been done.  I felt disgusted at the whole á situation.
label: disgust

text_A: When I do not put in the needed amount of hours of work or study á for the day, I feel guilty and try to make up for the lost á time.
label: guilt

text_A: When I got the scholarship I was very happy as the finacial á burden of the family was reduced.
label: joy

text_A: When the others did not do their bit of work on a group á assignment task, and I had to do all the work.
label: anger

text_A: I felt ashamed when I fought with my mother on some issue, and á caused her trouble.
label: shame

text_A: I had enough time to do my assignment, and I did not do it well.  á When the lecturer scolded me, I had this feeling.
label: guilt

text_A: When I was selected at TISS X.
label: joy

text_A: When I almost walked on a snake.
label: fear

text_A: When I was insulted by a man.
label: anger

text_A: [ When I see that the toilet is unclean.]
label: disgust

text_A: When my co-resident opened the bathroom door while I was bathing á inside.
label: shame

text_A: At the pre-university, I was appreciated as an examplary á student by our pricipal.  This is something which made me feel á very happy.
label: joy

text_A: [ No response.]
label: fear

text_A: When I was blamed for some of my attributes which are very often á misunderstood, especially when one is very frank.
label: anger

text_A: When my sister lost her only son, who was sixteen years old.  I á felt very bad about it as this was the first death in my family á and then I learned slowly to understand to life.
label: sadness

text_A: When I was in a Christian institution, sometimes the nuns would á send back the people who came to visit us when it was not the á visiting hours.  This disgusted me.
label: disgust

text_A: Once I was not able to give a relative, who was in a critical á period, a helping hand.  Whenever I think about it I feel guilty  á for letting down the person who trusted me to give him a helping á hand.
label: guilt

text_A: The day I got a letter from the U.G.C informing me that I had á been awarded the junior research fellowship.
label: joy

text_A: When a relative, who had come to our place, created untidyness á and dirtyness.
label: anger

text_A: When I had to leave home to go to some other place to study.
label: sadness

text_A: When I broke-down while seeing off my friend.
label: shame

text_A: [ When I have achieved what I wanted to achieve, I feel the above á stated emotion. Also when I am sucessful.]
label: joy

text_A: My friend and I were to attend a very important meeting and he á had promised to come and pick me up.  But he did not turn up and á I felt very angry at him.
label: anger

text_A: I was really hoping that I would pass the examination, but I á failed and so I felt very sad.
label: sadness

text_A: [ I feel disgusted at people who talk negatively about a person á without knowing the person well.]
label: disgust

text_A: [ Whenever I do something prohibited or wrong I feel guilty.]
label: guilt

text_A: I was very angry one day when my husband ignored me and slept      á on a separate bed.  He had no reasons to doubt me or to neglect á me and I had never imagined that he could do such a thing.
label: anger

text_A: When I heard the news of the death of my father.  It was in the á evening and I was alone all night in my room trying to remember á the face of my father.
label: sadness

text_A: One day my colleague misbehaved with me.  I felt disgusted and á thought to myself that he could only do this because I was a á woman.
label: disgust

text_A: One day I addressed my husband in an abusive manner in front of á his friends.  Later on I realized this myself and felt ashamed of á myself.
label: shame

text_A: My mother misunderstood me and prevented me from doing something. á  In return I did not talk to her for a few days, only later on I á realized that what she had done had been for my good.
label: guilt

text_A: When the results of the part I exams came out I felt tremendous á joy in my heart.  The results came out after a long period of á worry and anxiety, so it gave me endless relief and joy.
label: joy

text_A: I felt afraid just before receiving the question paper of the á part II exam.
label: fear

text_A: I remember that when I was in school I saw a case of partiality - á one of the teachers gave private coaching classes to some girls á and she would give these girls extra attention in class and would á ignore the others.
label: anger

text_A: On the last day of my school life I was very sad, specially on á the farewell party day.  I felt sad to leave behind my beloved á teachers and friends.
label: sadness

text_A: I did badly in one of the vital exams, despite getting proper á guidance from my parents.  I felt guilty of improper use of the á chances provided to me.
label: guilt

text_A: [ I can not recall one.]
label: joy

text_A: [ This emotion has never been an intense one, that makes it á difficult to recall it.]
label: anger

text_A: [ The previous incident holds good here also.]
label: disgust

text_A: [ ....has not really happened.]
label: shame

text_A: When an event took place in another's life and which I thought I á could have avoided.
label: guilt

text_A: I experience this emotion quite often but the day I was most á angry was the day I got pulled up for something I had not done.  á It happened during my school days, I had not spoken a word in á class but the monitor had written my name on the board.  So I á had a remark in my callender which I had to get signed by my á parents.  This remark resulted in me being spanked.
label: anger

text_A: This is an event I will never forget.  I am considered a good á mimic.  This particular day we were waiting for a professor á to take her class.  This  professor had a peculiar accent and a á very horrible way of lecturing and to top it all we had this á class at the fag end of the day.  So this particular day I got á into my element and started imitating the professor, and the á professor entered the class right in the middle of it .  I was á unaware of her presence, some of my friends tried to warn me but á it was of no avail as I was too engrossed in mimicing.  Then I á suddenly noticed the silence and turned around to see her á entering the class.  I do not know till today if she actually saw á what I had been doing or she had completely ignored it.  Through  á out that lecture I died of shame.  All the more shameful was the á fact that she gave me a character certificate.
label: shame

text_A: [ No response.]
label: guilt

text_A: This happened when it was finally confirmed that I had stood á first in the university for the M.A exams.  A few days before the á official results were declared a clerk had brought the results á unofficially.  So I had been expecting the results but the á confirmation allowed me to legitimately feel happy at my á success. á
label: joy

text_A: A new gas connection was to be installed and the mechanic who came á to do it was very rude to my mother and me.  I rushed to thhe á dealer with my mother and had a fight with the dealer as he á seemed to be unreasonable and was taking the mechanic's side.  á Ultimately the matter was resolved after my father went and spoke á to him.  The mechanic was asked to apologize.
label: anger

text_A: The day I was to receive my gold-medal for the M.A, my á grandmother, who I loved very much, died after an illness.  She  á died a few hours before the convocation.  While I was á attending the convocation I had to control my grief as she would á not have liked me to miss it.  It was a day she had been waiting á for, but did not get to see.
label: sadness

text_A: We had come back from a programme and we were all (three girls)    á staying over at another girls placce.  One of them started á passing very nasty and outright bitchy remarks at me.  It was á brought on by a male colleague's compliments to me, this girl was á herself interested in this guy.  Bitchiness and catty remarks á made by women never fail to disgust me.  I can particularly á remember this incident as she knew that I had not encouraged the  á guy.
label: disgust

text_A: I was coming back home with my mother when the purse I was á carrying got stolen.  It was done so swifty that I did not á realize what had happened till much later.  A lot of money and the á keys of the house were lost.  I was guilt ridden at my á carelessness.  I felt terrible as I do not normally loose things á and this was quite important, especially the keys.á
label: guilt

text_A: When I had gone to a school picnic and was left behind in the á forest.
label: fear

text_A: When I saw a few people beating a man who seemed to be a á stranger.
label: anger

text_A: When India lost the Benson and Hedges cricket trophy.
label: sadness

text_A: When India won the Prudential cup by beating West-Indies in the á final match and became the world cricket champion.  West-Indies á was the strongest of the eight countries which participated in á the competition.
label: joy

text_A: As a child, one evening I had read a novel about ghosts and I had á thus spent a sleepless night as I kept feeling that there were á ghosts dancing around me.
label: fear

text_A: Despite our good performance and excellent results the management á refused to meet our demands.
label: anger

text_A: When my beloved girlfriend got married to another person.
label: sadness

text_A: When I heard that a 14 years old girl had been raped by four á rikshaw drivers in our town.
label: disgust

text_A: I feel ashamed at the fact that even after 35 years of independence   á 70% of the Indian poulation is still below the poverty line.
label: shame

text_A: One day, early morning my mother who is healthy fell ill.  There á was no doctor or compounder near by and for a few hours -8 A.M to á 6 P.M she did not speak a single sentence, nor did she drink water á or  milk.  There was no movement in her body and I felt really á scared.  I almost lost my confidence about her survival.
label: fear

text_A: One day my elder brother badly scolded my father.  This was the á first time that I heard such abusive language from my brother.  I á requested him humbly not to use this kind of language but he did á not care for what I was saying.  Finally I picked up an axe to use á against him, in the meanwhile people intervened.
label: anger

text_A: My close friend and I applied to TISS for admission last year, á unfortunately he failed to get admission.  We had done our graduation á together and are quite involved with each other, so we had wanted á to do our Masters degree together.  However, it did not work out á as we had expected it to and this saddened me.
label: sadness

text_A: My classmate at TISS has the habit of biting his nails and ever á since my childhood I have never liked this habit.  This person is á near me in class, dining hall and the campus so I suggested that á he should stop biting his nails.  However he found it difficult á and my disgust feelings have not changed.
label: disgust

text_A: I had this feeling before my graduation and never dared to speak á to my relatives and  friends.  Because of this feeling I would á avoid situations, however I do not know the reason for this.
label: shame

text_A: When I was in my village one of my enemies had written a á non-sense letter to a girl and he told the father of this girl á that I was the culprit.  When I got to know this I was scared as  á the girl's father was a worse man.
label: fear

text_A: When I was doing research a few months ago, I had asked the á Institute to sponsor me for a computer course which was held in á TISS.  However, because of the administrative officer I could not á get the money.
label: anger

text_A: When I was in Bombay one of my good friends was getting married á and he had not informed me about it, this made me sad.
label: sadness

text_A: Some time back I had signed a letter which I had not read.  What á had happened is that something had been written against my á friend and this went to the higher authorities.  My friend asked me  á -\you also signed ?\"   "
label: shame

text_A: [ I am joyfull to be alive every night.]
label: joy

text_A: [ On discovering the red-tapism and the bureaucratic, corrupt, á decadent, degenerated infrastucture of every public utility, á office and service; and the rampant corruption at every single á level of education and other institutions.]
label: anger

text_A: The death of Jaya Prakash Narayan caused a great deal of sadness á as I believed that he was the only true democrat and a ray of á hope on the Indian horizon.
label: sadness

text_A: [ This is an everyday feeling.  Many situational events : causes á are unclean and dirty environment, illiteracy, poverty and á neglect of human resources, disgust at the lack of perception on á the part of us ( educated few) for the lack of drive and drive á towards their redemption. ]
label: disgust

text_A: When I realized that I was not working hard enough and was not á being useful as an individual to the society or the family, guilt á at spending money on uncalled for activities - in short wasting á my life.
label: guilt

text_A: My joy knew no bounds when I was selected for a job even before á having finished my studies.
label: joy

text_A: I was scared when I realized that I might miss the train which I á was supposed to take.  I was 1500 Kilometres away from home and when  á I heard the depart whistle I was still 150 feet away from the á train.  I finally made it.
label: fear

text_A: I feel disgusted since I am unable to cope with all the wordly á affairs as I spend much precious time to pursue my hobby and á to be admist the people I love and long to be with.
label: disgust

text_A: I always feel ashamed when I do not succeed in accomplishing á something in which I had put in all my efforts.
label: shame

text_A: At times I have been attracted to conducts which are socially á degraded due to their ill consequences, and then I feel guilty.
label: guilt

text_A: When India first won the world cup cricket tournament.
label: joy

text_A: I was travelling from Delhi to Bombay.  I had booked a seat one á month back and I had also got a telegram confirming this.  á However, in the train my name had been omitted from the á reservation sheet, and the one seat that was still vacant was á alloted to another person who paid for it despite my requests for the á seat.  I was allowed to stay in the reserved compartment when I á paid money.
label: anger

text_A: The news of the natural calamity, an earthquake in which hundreds  á of Mexican people died.
label: sadness

text_A: [ No response.]
label: guilt

text_A: One of my fellow students had bunked field work and in my attempt á to cover up for him I myself was exposed, though not directly.  á We were to meet our field work suprevisor and we were afraid of á the consequences.
label: fear

text_A: I had made an error in planning a programme and had publicly á accepted the mistake, despite repeated requests not to bring the á matter for discussion a professor kept constantly passing remarks. á I reacted angrily.á
label: anger

text_A: I was in love with a girl but had to separate from her because of á different commitments concerning life and career.  I loved her as á a person but could not agree with the life the future would á demand.  Parting from her was very sad.
label: sadness

text_A: Students on campus were unnecessarily creating trouble just to á heckle the authorities - not to achieve something concrete, but á to further their own interest.
label: disgust

text_A: I had promised to send something to a friend and it completely á slipped my mind.  I felt guilty for having forgotten.
label: guilt

text_A: A few weeks back I had a very important seminar and I had á circulated my papers to all the panel members.  A day before the á seminar I realized that I had inadvertantly burdened certain       á derivations and I had failed to correct it.  I feared that this    á would reflect very badly on my performance.  Fortunately none of  á the panel members detected it and I felt relieved.
label: fear

text_A: The saddest moment in my life was when I lost my younger sister a á few years back.
label: sadness

text_A: Yesterday, I was just about to cross the road when a country guy á who was ahead of me spat out a mouthful of betel juice on the á road.  It was very windy and had I not checked my speed I would á have had a very good shower of his saliva.  Though I was not á angry, I felt that these people were very indecent.
label: disgust

text_A: Yesterday while playing volley ball, there was one person extra    á and somebody had to out.  A mess worker and I were the  á last ones to arrive and we had arrived at the same time.  á Rightfully one of us had to opt out of the game, as I was á delaying leaving the mess worker opted out saying that I should á play.  I felt ashamed of myself.
label: shame

text_A: A few days back a friend of mine had asked me to call on him on á Sunday.  I had accepted it but later did not go for no specific   á reason.  I just slept in my room.  The next day this friend called  á me up and told me that he had been expecting me the day before and á his wife had prepared a very good lunch for me, which had gone á waste.  I felt very bad about this incident and it has been á growing in my heart ever since.
label: guilt

text_A: Before the declaration of the S.S.C results.
label: fear

text_A: When I was punished in school for no serious mistake of mine.
label: anger

text_A: When I received the S.Y.J.C results, the marks I obtained were á not up to my expectations and I missed admission in engineering.
label: sadness

text_A: When I was detained one day in school, by the vice-principal, for á indiscipline.
label: shame

text_A: This happened when I was in the 10th standard.  The paddy crops á were in a bad shape as it had not rained and there was no water á in the well, so I was in a very sad mood.  I came to the á conclusion that I would ignore the paddy field, just 12 hours á after this it rained for one hour.  This was a very tense time á and the rain brought me tremendous pleasure.
label: joy

text_A: One day my room-mate started imitating me, doing what I had done á a few hours back.  I got very angry and started beating him up.
label: anger

text_A: A few months back I had gone to my friend's place and they offered á me tea and coffee.  I do not have the habit of drinking tea or á coffee and so they offered me a glass of milk instead, so I felt ashamed.
label: shame

text_A: After my graduation exams I was waiting to get admitted to a post á graduation course, however the situation was not very favourable á for me and I was upset.  Suddenly, Bombay university offered me a á seat and I landed up in Bombay for my post graduation studies.  á This happened last year and was very pleasant for me.
label: joy

text_A: [ Never experienced.]
label: fear

text_A: This was the worst incident of my hostel life.  I was insulted by á a close friend of mine on the eve of the New year and it totally á spoiled my New year's night.
label: anger

text_A: [ Never experienced.]
label: disgust

label: joy

label: fear

text_A: Once a friend had pushed me and I had fallen on to a window which á then broke.  I was taken to tthe principal's office and he á accused me of having broken the window.
label: anger

text_A: When I received my S.Y.J.C results which did not allow me to get   á admission in engineering.

text_A: Once when I was studying for my examination, I was asked to do á some work which was unavoidable.

label: shame

text_A: During class one day I walked out of the class.  The á teacher noticed it and decided that he would take some action á against me, when I realized this I approached him and told him á that I was sorry for the incident and would not repeat it.
label: guilt

text_A: My illness a few years back.  I was sevely down with malaria and á asthma, I had lost my health, charm and cheerfulness completely.
label: fear

label: anger

text_A: My father's death in January 1983 moved me deeply.  The gloom á prevailed for almost two years and I am still to recover from it.
label: sadness

label: shame

label: fear

text_A: I felt guilty when I thought that I was still not standing on my á own feet.

label: joy

label: disgust

text_A: [ I was not, I am not, I will never ever feel ashamed of á myself for something I have done.]
label: shame

text_A: I most joyous moment was the day I got my marks.  I was very á happy when I came to know about my marks at the M.Sc (part I) á examination where I got 71.5%.  This was the highest marks I have á ever scored in my life.
label: joy

text_A: When my brother was selected to the University of Malawi (the á Polythecnic). I was very excited and I rejoiced due to one of our á family members qualifying for University level at long last.
label: joy

text_A: I felt very sad when I was in Form three to notice that my friend á Barley Jumbe, had lost very expensive new sports short trousers.
label: sadness

text_A: Four weeks ago I felt very much touched to find an asciatic á patient who had asked the very morning to be tapped of the fluid, á dying in the evening. I was really disgusted because this was the á Medical staff's negligence. Had the Clinical officers done á something that very morning he might have been alive today.
label: disgust

text_A: Guilt conscious struck me when I failed my Standard Two á Examinations in 1972. I knew that I would suffer the consequences á of what I had been doing during class hours: thus playing with á friends and sometimes not even going to school.
label: guilt

text_A: After sitting for the Standard 8 Exams for the second time in á 1979, I had great joy when I heard that I was successful in the á Examination when the results were out.
label: joy

text_A: I never failed my examinations since Standard 1 but I experienced á sad moments when I sat for Standard 8 Examination and I was not á selected for Secondary School education in 1978.
label: sadness

text_A: I had experienced odd moments one time when a patient came into á the Ward in which I was working. The patient was badly burnt in á the right side of her body. I was very nervous at the sight.
label: disgust

text_A: When I was young I was playing football near my parent's house á and while playing I fell on the ground. At first I thought I was á not seen by anybody, but when my mother laughed I felt very á ashamed.
label: shame

text_A: I had been on friendship with a certain girl for sometime and the á love was going on well, but it happened that I made the á friendship come to an end suddenly without good reasons.
label: guilt

text_A: I was emotionally happy when I was in love with the girl I had á longed for.
label: joy

text_A: I once felt that my last hour had come when I was unexpectedly found á in the hands of.
label: fear

text_A: It happened that my brother promised to give me money for school á and then he told me that he had failed to fulfil his promise a á day before school started. I became so angry for I thought my á future would be ruined.
label: anger

text_A: The first day I visited the hospital I was disgusted because I á experienced offensive smell which I never expected. I nearly ran á away from the course.
label: disgust

text_A: I felt guilty when I was robbed of a friend's radio at Lilongwe á bus depot after promising that I would keep it safe.
label: guilt

text_A: When mum had beaten my young sister just because she had received á a letter from a boyfriend.
label: disgust

text_A: When I had not done well in Geography at my MCE I was expected to á get more than I did.
label: shame

text_A: When a patient had died soon after I had told the guardian to á wait outside the ward.
label: guilt

text_A: The time when I cleaned the house and everything was tidy, á then my cousin, who is 4 years old, came with a muddy pot and made á a mess of the whole thing.
label: disgust

text_A: Failed to do what I had promised.
label: guilt

text_A: Saw on TV China winning the gold medals.
label: joy

label: fear

label: disgust

text_A: My friend started to misunderstand and hurt me.

label: disgust

label: shame

text_A: Hurt someone's feelings unintentionally.

label: guilt

text_A: Telling friends about your nickname.
label: guilt

label: joy

label: fear

text_A: I was very sad  when I got the XIIth standard results, when I got á low marks as compared to my friend and I could not get admission á to courses like medicine.
label: sadness

label: sadness

text_A: When I opted for my research field, for them the percentage of á marks was more important than my knowledge.

text_A: When I was not in a position to control myself.  I had said too á much and had been cruel with no other than my mother.

text_A: When I had been angry at my friend without any reason.

text_A: When I forced a close friend of mine to ask a girl things about á herself.

text_A: It was about a fortnight ago, I was declared successful in the á U.G.C exam this year (only four in Bombay succeeded).  My joy á knew no bounds.
label: joy

text_A: When I was a kid, I always opened the door to greet my father á when he came back from work.  One day it so happened that his á hair was scattered due to over-crowding in the train, and when I á opened the door as usual I saw something else.  I was so scared á that I could not talk.
label: fear

text_A: This also happened when I was very small.  I was beaten up by my  á mother for no fault of mine, I had just beaten up my younger á brother for what I thought was his fault.  I was very angry with á my mother.
label: anger

label: disgust

text_A: When I got admission in M.Sc (I) Organic Chemistry, I was very á happy.
label: joy

text_A: I was very angry when my friend lost my practical's journal, á which I needed to study for the exams.
label: anger

text_A: I was disgusted when our cricket team manager dropped me from the á team.
label: disgust

text_A: I was ashamed at myself when I saw that the other boys and girls   á of my age earn a lot of money by doing very good and hard work.
label: shame

label: guilt

text_A: When I was going to take the practical exams.
label: fear

text_A: When I was bluffing in front of my mother to get more money.

text_A: The moment I got the news that I had been selected for the U.G.C á junior national research fellowship.  It was a dream come true.
