text_A: A friend of mine was hospitalized after having been diagnosed as á having typhoid, he had to forgo his exams and also his ambition á of doing a dissertation at the M.A level.  It was a very sad á event for me and I felt very sorry for him so I volunteered to á stay with him in the hospital.
label: sadness

text_A: There was a family fight in my house some time back.  My uncle á had given me a watch as a present and I lost it.  During the á fight he accused me of having sold the watch.  I was disgusted at á his false accusations.
label: disgust

text_A: My friend had written a letter to me, the contents of which I á misunderstood and I wrote back a very harsh letter to her.  On á realizing the blunder I had made, I felt like hiding my face in á the sand.
label: guilt

text_A: I have a girlfriend, who is almost like a daughter to me.  She is á studying out of station and I get to see her only once a year.  á Her arrival is always a joyous one.
label: joy

text_A: A railways officer, when asked by the ticket checker to produce á his tickets, got very aggressive and started abusing and using á his authority in a very wrong way.
label: disgust

text_A: [ I am quite shameless, not applicable.]
label: shame

text_A: [ Not applicable.]
label: guilt

text_A: When I was treated improperly by someone.
label: fear

text_A: [ When bad and disgusting language is uttered by people, or when á someone tries to show what is beyond his own capacities.]
label: anger

text_A: [ I missed my twin when I was on the verge of being thrown, which á I disliked.]
label: sadness

text_A: When Kanishka was blown up, I really felt disgusted at people á killing each other.
label: disgust

text_A: [ No response.]
label: guilt

text_A: When I received the best actor award at the inter-college drama á competition.  It gave me tremendous joy and satisfaction which á lasted for several days.
label: joy

text_A: When my mother met with a serious accident and there was danger á that she would not survive and if she did she would loose á her memory.
label: fear

text_A: When an acquaintance of mine beat up another person for no just á reason, and thus showed off his power.
label: anger

text_A: When a friend of mine died in a hiking accident.  I was not á present there and only got the news later.
label: sadness

text_A: [ Do not remember any incident.]
label: guilt

text_A: I felt this emotion when my name was announced on the radio that á I had been selected to come to Lilongwe School for Health á Sciences to take a training course as a Medical Assistat.
label: joy

text_A: I felt the above condition when I took my brother's bicycle to a á market and unfortunately the bicycle was stolen and I didn't know á how I could tell the owner about the stolen bicycle.
label: fear

text_A: I felt angry when my only pair of trousers was stolen and could á not be able to find out who the thief was or anyone who knew á about the story.
label: anger

text_A: I felt the above condition when I was found in a house playing á with another man's wife where I was asked questions and I was á unable to answer.
label: shame

text_A: I was living with my brother and one day he went away on business á and I was left alone to look after the house and the property. At á night thieves came and wanted to break into the house.
label: fear

text_A: My young brother took my wristwatch in my abscence and sold it to á his friend at a cheaper price.
label: anger

text_A: One day I took my playmates to the river to swim and play. One á of them was epileptic so he drowned into the water. I felt guilty á because it was me who took them there.
label: guilt

text_A: It is some years ago when my mother found me stealing relish in á the pot. It was fresh fish which was very appetising.
label: guilt

text_A: In March I was busy studying during the night I could only sleep á two or three hours only for fear that I would be weeded and sent á back.
label: fear

text_A: I was once nominated as an Officer Cadet in the Armed Forces and á my name was cancelled on the list of nominees of those who were á sent to Kenya for Training.
label: sadness

text_A: It was last week on Sunday that I was walking with my girlfriend á along Kawale road going to town so I tried to stop a car for a á lift and the driver didn't stop and I felt shame because people á were looking at us.
label: shame

text_A: I was once called in court in Zemba Traditional court to answer a á charge of impregnanting a young lady, I felt guilty for she had á some letters which I used to write her as an exhibit in court.
label: guilt

text_A: There was joy in me when I heard that I was to take a course as a á Medical Assistant.
label: joy

text_A: When I saw a dead body in the mortuary I became afraid and I was á filled with fear.
label: fear

text_A: A certain Area Party Secretary came home in the morning and said á we had to leave our home and build somewhere and the reason á being that they wanted to establish a market. The Chairman knew á nothing about it and was very angry.
label: anger

text_A: I was so sad when I heard that my Uncle had passed away. He was á the only man who was supporting my parents as well as myself.
label: sadness

text_A: It was a shameful moment when I heard that I had failed my á Primary School leaving Certificate Exam in 1978. My girlfriend á was there when the news was released.
label: shame

text_A: I took Pharmacology books from my friend's desk without á permission and I was found guilty.
label: guilt

text_A: When I was in Form 4, at Secondary School, I was elected as a á school Library Assistant and also the leader of Catholic á Students, so I felt very joyous.
label: joy

text_A: I broke my Uncle's Radio player accidentally and so I feared that á he was going to cut me off from going to his house as well as á playing it again.
label: fear

text_A: It was in March 1985 when one of my fellow students borrowed my á wristwatch and after sometime he broke a glass of that watch I á got angry when he was telling me but the anger didn't take long á to fade.
label: anger

text_A: When I was about to write my Junior Certificate Exams, I received á sad news telling me that my elder sister had passed away.
label: sadness

text_A: The joy came to me when I heard that I was going to start a á Medical course at the Lilongwe School for Health Sciences.
label: joy

text_A: The emotion came when a certain boy opened my locker without my á knowledge.
label: anger

text_A: The emotion came to me when a certain girl who was not polite to á her mother hit her sister severely.
label: disgust

text_A: When I was told that I was selected to attend Medical Assistant á Training.
label: joy

text_A: This situation happened when my friend John ate my banana which I á kept in the cupboard.
label: anger

text_A: This situation occurred when I entered into a smelling ward.
label: disgust

text_A: When my father married a certain lady. The reception was held at á Kasungu town Hall.
label: joy

text_A: At night when I was coming from Lingadzi Inn I heard a hyena á crying in the Lingadzi jungle. I was alone.
label: fear

text_A: I felt sad when I was told to walk out of the classroom because I á was within the row of students who were making noise.
label: sadness

text_A: I felt disgusted when a certain lady spoke words of sarcasm when á I was trying to propose to her.
label: disgust

text_A: When I broke a tea saucer. I felt ashamed. This was during the á birthday of my girlfriend.
label: shame

text_A: I was given a wristwatch by my first girl and after two days á another girl of mine also gave me a wristwatch.
label: fear

text_A: My girlfriend mentioned a certain girl's name who was my girl á some time back and she is no longer mine that she said she was á still mine.
label: anger

text_A: I had been caught red-handed having stolen some paw-paw. I was á then taken the elders owning the paw-paws.
label: sadness

text_A: I was double crossing Mercy and Maria. They one day came to know á each other. I was found by Mercy red-haded when I was with Maria.
label: disgust

text_A: I had a girlfriend in the same class I was. I did not do well in á my Exams, but she did satisfactorily well and was taken into á another class leaving me behind.
label: shame

text_A: Our Headmaster came to our hostel. The lights were off but there á was a lot of noise. We shouted at him when he knocked at our á door. We later saw that it was the Headmaster.
label: guilt

text_A: As I was taking venous blood from another patient I introduced á air into the place of puncturing and there was a swelling which á is dangerous to the patient hence I became afraid.
label: fear

text_A: My lovely girlfriend double-crossed me and so that I found her á chatting with another guy.
label: anger

text_A: I really became sad when mother passed away while I was very á young.
label: sadness

text_A: I was disgusted when my brother was arrested because of stealing á money.
label: disgust

text_A: I was ashamed when my classmates discovered that I fell in love á with an uneducated girl.
label: shame

text_A: I felt guilty when I lost K43 for my friend when he was arrested.
label: guilt

text_A: I felt joy when I passed my Malawi School Certificate of á Education.
label: joy

text_A: I was angry when I heard that my only girl was going about with á another man. So I decided to drop her but later the story came to á be untrue.
label: anger

text_A: When I was presumed to have stolen maize from the school garden.
label: disgust

text_A: I once proposed my own niece whom I did not know but I discovered á after she was my girlfriend.
label: shame

text_A: A certain colleague of mine sent me to buy a bag of flour for him, á he gave me K20. Unfortunately I lost it.
label: guilt

text_A: When I married my wife and took her home for the first time.
label: joy

text_A: When my friend was involved in a car accident.
label: fear

text_A: When I was charmed by my relatives.
label: anger

text_A: When I entered the wound intensive care at the Central Hospital á in Blantyre which was stinking.
label: disgust

text_A: When I first failed my standard 8 exams for the first attempt for á Form I selection.
label: shame

text_A: When I had beaten my auntie.
label: guilt

text_A: My friend took me to Civo Stadium to watch and listen to the á music of the International singer Sam Mangwana. I had no hope of á going there since I had no money so he gave me the money for á admission.
label: joy

text_A: I had fear when I was left alone at the bus depot at night. I had á problems of how to move to this place.
label: fear

text_A: I felt angry when I heard that my sister had failed the á Examinations which we hoped she was going to pass with á distinctions.
label: anger

text_A: I felt sad when I heard that my girlfriend was double-crossing me á with the boy who is my best friend.
label: sadness

text_A: I felt disgust when I saw a friend walking in stagnant water á without putting on gum boots.
label: disgust

text_A: I felt guilty of revealing a secret to my in-law. I told her that á my brother and I had gone to disconight which is a thing my á brother didn't want to let her know. Later my brother was accused á of spending a night out.
label: guilt

text_A: The joy came when I first proposed a girl at Secondary School.
label: joy

text_A: As I was in a ward one man died and I was instructed to watch the á last offices. But this was my first time to see a dead person - á fear came.
label: fear

text_A: I was ashamed when a certain friend of mine I used to move with á failed to propose to a lady yet we always said to ourselves no á lady can refuse our proposal.
label: shame

text_A: I felt guilty when one of my secondary teacher left me while I á was in Form three, he was the only one who showed love to me.
label: guilt

text_A: My sister gave birth to twins, healthy ones.
label: joy

text_A: I planned to travel a distance of 20 kilometres on my bike. I á planned this when I was working in the hospital. When I went to á the house I found that a friend had taken my bike without my á consent.
label: anger

text_A: A sister broke a cup and when mother asked I was reported to have á been responsible.
label: disgust

text_A: This emotion happened when I passed my primary school examination á and was selected for Secondary School.
label: joy

text_A: I was disgusted when I was told to dress a big rotten stinky á wound which, coming closer, made me feel like vomitting.
label: disgust

text_A: I was ashamed one day when we were found stealing and roasting á maize cobs from Agricultural experimental projects.
label: shame

text_A: I felt guilty when the truth was known about my impregnating the á girl we were staying with.
label: guilt

text_A: I was walking alone along the place where people fear that there á are always thieves there and the people who kill their friends á during the night two months ago.
label: fear

text_A: I once was accused of falling in love with someone's girlfriend á which was not true because the girl was just a friend of mine.
label: anger

text_A: It was when I was allowed to take my wife away from her parents á after being refused for three times on grounds that she should á first write her examination.
label: joy

text_A: When two hyenas made crying noise on the window of my bedroom at á home when I was preparing for my MCE examination during the á night.
label: fear

text_A: I slept in a tent at the Barracks which caught fire at night and á my best possessions got burnt in there.
label: sadness

text_A: When parents of a certain girl refused to let me marry their á daughter because I was not fit to do so yet the girl accepted á everything and later she followed what her parents insisted and á she told me never to talk to her again.
label: shame

text_A: The time I was at secondary school during the holiday I appeared á to my father while heavily drunk and I talked nonsense like in á some sort of carefree.
label: guilt

text_A: This came in when at one time I met a girl who I didn't expect to á fall in love with me. Fortunately I tried my luck and she accepted á my proposal. At the same time she was giving me a lot of money á which was just like a miracle to me.
label: joy

text_A: When I was at school.
label: sadness

text_A: One of those days when I was going to school with my brother and á he annoyed me.
label: disgust

text_A: This was when one of the Clinical officers scolded us in the á hospital on how to make beds but we did not deserve to be á scolded.
label: shame

text_A: Fear came towards the end of May when the P.T.S. results were out á after hearing the failure of my fellow three friends.
label: fear

text_A: This condition accumulated in my mind when funeral news was á brought to my awareness, that a close relative had passed away.
label: sadness

text_A: A condition in which I was disgusted followed when I lost money á on my way home from the college.
label: disgust

text_A: I was very ashamed when I was neglected by a certain friend whom á I was thinking loved me very much.
label: shame

text_A: I once felt guilty when a certain passenger in the same (ship, á plane ?) which I boarded when coming from home lost his 10t which á in fact fell into my pocket unknowingly.
label: guilt

text_A: It was when I was selected to go to a Secondary school to start á form I.
label: joy

text_A: It was when I stepped on a python (snake) unknowingly while it á was sleeping near a baobab tree.
label: fear

text_A: It was when my friend had stolen my money (K10) and had á disappeared.
label: anger

text_A: It was when I drunk urine during my childhood thinking it was á water. My friend had urinated in the tin.
label: disgust

text_A: It was when I injured a friend accidentally with a stone. It made á a cut on the cheeks which resulted in suturing.
label: guilt

text_A: My brother had bowel obstruction, having heard that he was going á for surgery, I was afraid he might not come back to life after á hearing of the General Anaesthesia.
label: fear

text_A: I was away to school (Primary). In my abscence my young brother á at home got sick suddenly. My parents took him to hospital. On á the way he died. It came to me as a sad, sudden and shocking á news and I felt very sad.
label: sadness

text_A: I felt disgusted when I went to one of the Central hospitals á where my hope of getting good treatment was turned down by one of á the doctors who said I was alright despite my feeling pain.
label: disgust

text_A: I was in my room, I just heard that my Uncle had been caught in á somebody's house with somebody's wife. He had to appear in court. á I went to see what would happen to him.
label: shame

text_A: When I heard that I had passed Primary School Leaving Certificate á and was selected to go for Secondary education.
label: joy

text_A: When I heard that there is teasing and bulling at Secondary á School.
label: fear

text_A: When I heard that I was not to be provided with another pair of á medical uniform.
label: anger

text_A: When I vomitted a lump of blood.
label: disgust

text_A: When I didn't notify someone that he was summoned by a headmaster á and as a result he ended being on a heavy punishment.
label: guilt

text_A: I met my girlfriend on the way and she joyfully welcomed me on á the way home.
label: joy

text_A: An incident occurred to me when I was going home with my á girlfriend. On the way, a man named Banda grabbed my girlfriend á in my presence. I was really angry with him and as a result I á threw stones at him and he ran away.
label: anger

text_A: I was really disgusted when I saw one of my friends soiling on á his clothes. I thought he was mad.
label: disgust

text_A: One day I went for a bath. I took off my clothes and as soon as I á had finished my brother came in. I felt sad and I found no reason á why he came in.
label: shame

text_A: One day I took a packet of sweets from a certain Grocery at á Nathenje. Then later on I started to feel guilty and realised á that I had done a wrong thing to him.
label: guilt

text_A: When we were going to Nkhoma last Saturday the vehicle was moving á very fast, so I feared we might crash since the road was too á rough.
label: fear

text_A: I felt very sad when I lost my three Kwacha at civo Stadium when á Sam Mangwana was playing some Rumba records. That was not what I á expected, I wanted some Disco records.
label: sadness

text_A: In ward 2A there was a patient suffering from Syphilitic á Paraplegia and had pressure sores. The wounds had offensive smell á that only a few people .... the place.
label: disgust

text_A: It was when we were beaten or lost the football match by 5-1 and á then I scored the third goal to my own side.
label: shame

text_A: When I scored the third goal to my own side at a football match á against William Murray Secondary School and we were badly á defeated.
label: guilt

text_A: On December the 28th I was filled with Joy when I was told by my á bosses that I had been selected to attend a course at the á Lilongwe School for Health Scienced in Lilongwe.
label: joy

text_A: It was last week on Saturday night when I was at Mchesi. I feared á to cross the Lilongwe River Bridge to come back to School due to á darkness - until somebody had to escort me.
label: fear

text_A: It was at Malawi Army, Dormer Squadron, when some of my workmates á got promoted to Seargents (sgts); we were having similar á Ranks.
label: anger

text_A: It was mid May 1985, When we had a Test on Nursing. My classmate á had an answer sheet, so he tried to peep. The Nursing Tutor á caught him. During this time I was turning my question paper and á it made noise. This friend blamed me of causing the whole matter á for him to be caught.
label: sadness

text_A: In May somebody blamed me that I made him to be caught while á peeping during the Nursing Test which made me feel disgusted.
label: disgust

text_A: It was on January 1st 1985 when I accidentally broke a Fanta á bottle in a certain bottle store in Zomba.
label: guilt

text_A: I felt joy when I heard over the radio that I had been successful á in my Primary School Leaving Certificate Examination and was á selected for Secondary School.
label: joy

text_A: It was on 9th January 1983 when I received a message from home á telling me that my father passed away on the previous day with a á history of cancer of the oesophagus. This time I was doing my á third year of my Secondary School.
label: sadness

text_A: I was stopped from entering a party while I was at School but I á had an Invitation card with me. This was done because they said I á was too young to join elderly people.
label: disgust

text_A: When it was found that I had gone out of the school premises á without permisssion and at the wrong time.
label: fear

text_A: Soiled my short trousers with faeces.
label: shame

text_A: When a crawling child got burnt because of my negligence to keep á the child away from the fire.
label: guilt

text_A: When I heard my name being announced on the radio that I had been á successful in an interview for admittance for a medical Assistant á training course. I was really happy and I enjoyed myself by á dancing to music from the Radio cassette.
label: joy

text_A: One day I was really angry when all my food was eaten by a dog. á My anger was against my mother because she was careless. She á didn't keep the food in a hidden and proper place.
label: anger

text_A: One day I came across a certain boy who was intruding my á friendship as lovers with my girlfriend and I was very sad á because I didn't expect that girl to disappoint me I regarded her á as being very faithful.
label: sadness

text_A: One time at the hospital I passed near the intensive care room. á The offensive smell that came out disgusted me in such a way that á I didn't even dare to enter the room.
label: disgust

text_A: At one occasion I was ashamed of being refused after a proposal á for a friendship with a certain girl. I was ashamed because she á refused publically in the presence of my fellow friends.
label: shame

text_A: I once stole my father's money and denied having done it. Instead á father threatened my young brother and he was beaten. He was á innocent and I felt guilty.
label: guilt

text_A: When I was selected to start Form I at Chilumba Secondary School á out of the 100 pupils I was among the 4 who were successful. á Family History showed that I had done better than all my brothers á who had passed after repeating for several times.
label: joy

text_A: We went fishing some 5 or 8 kilometers off the shore of Lake á Malawi. Before we could settle down the lake became very rough to á the point of threatening our lives.
label: fear

text_A: I was angered by a classmate who poured soup on to my clothes. He á was trying to use a short-cut method in getting his supper. á Coming behind my back, he wasn't noticed by me and as I was á retreating from a hungry congested people I knocked his plate á with my head. He didn't accept being wrong but blamed me for á pouring his soup.
label: anger

text_A: I was sad when my MCE grades were out. I had gone for a football á match a mile away from home. The mail found me there. I was á disappointed and didn't play the other half of the match.
label: sadness

text_A: I was dancing Malipenga (traditional dance). I exaggerated the á steps I was supposed to make in the negative way. This happened in á front of spectators. It was bad for our Boma (group) because I á was on the front line where ability is displayed and it is this á ability that counts when choosing the winning side.
label: disgust

text_A: News was spread that I had been found doing sexual intercourse á with a small girl. At first this annoyed me but later on I became á ashamed because many people seemed to believe it.
label: shame

text_A: I passed my MCE Examination. at first I was worried but when I á heard my name I had joy in my heart and I arranged for a trip to á attend a wedding ceremony.
label: joy

text_A: I was studying in class at night. I was in Form II by then. There á were rumours about an earthquake. That night dogs were chasing á one another and passed through the window outside the classroom. á Those who saw the dogs thought it was a lion and were terrified. á Trying to run away the desks were dragged and there was a shaking á movement. I thought it was an earthquake and jumped out of the á window.
label: fear

text_A: Someone told a lie that I had stolen his money.
label: anger

text_A: I answered a certain question from Dr. Maqgda wrongly. She asked á something about Femur and my answer was saying something á concerning the brain. So I was very ashamed amongst my friends.
label: shame

text_A: I wrote a bad letter to someone concerning our relationship which á we created ourselves.
label: guilt

text_A: My father gave me money for school fees and I didn't pay school á fees instead I spent it on beer and did not tell him about this.
label: fear

text_A: There was a cup final match between Limbe Leaf Wanderers and á Silver Strikers and someone promised to give me some money for á admission fee to watch this game. Unfortunately he did not give á me.
label: anger

text_A: It happened that one of my best friends just took my shirt á without my knowledge, I hadn't put it on for many days and I was á short of clothes.
label: disgust

text_A: I had high-heeled shoes one time, but a certain girl who saw the á shoes told me that they were out of fashion and I looked as an á old man when I was in those shoes.
label: shame

text_A: After hearing the news about the death of my sister, I felt very á sad.
label: sadness

text_A: After buying a ticket, I lost it before I reached my destination á and the bus Inspector dropped me at a place I didn't know.
label: disgust

text_A: I was very much ashamed after a friend beat me at school and I á was defeated.
label: shame

text_A: When I was selected to a University College of Nursing.
label: joy

text_A: When one of my relatives went out at night leaving me and my á friend alone, I cheated my parents that she didn't go out, after á they had heard that she was out, I was afraid that she might have á beaten me.
label: fear

text_A: When someone took my writing materials yet I was to write á Examinations in a few minutes.
label: anger

text_A: When I failed my Standard 8 Examination for the first time.
label: sadness

text_A: After I had cheated my parents that I had lost my textbooks so á they had to send me money.
label: guilt

text_A: I felt joy when I heard my name being called on the radio as one á of the students who had passed the interview of Nursing and was á selected to start Nursing.
label: joy

text_A: I felt fear when one night my aunt and Uncle left me alone at á their house to look after the baby when they went to a party.
label: fear

text_A: I felt sad when a thief stole all the clothes from my friend's á cupboard at school (boarding).
label: sadness

text_A: I felt disgusted when I was not given money for lunch at school á by my father as a punishment for beating my little brother.
label: disgust

text_A: When I passed my MSCE Exams and was selected to go to college.
label: joy

text_A: I was with my boyfriend forgetting that I had left the house á unlocked. Unfortunatly a thief came and stole all the kitchen á utensils. Thereafter I was afraid of the consequences.
label: fear

text_A: My best friend started moving out with my boyfriend. When I heard á this my heart sank because I didn't expect that my own good á friend could do such a thing, so I got angry.
label: anger

text_A: I was sad when I heard that my cousin died because of being á bewitched by her husband's second wife.
label: sadness

text_A: I met a woman who was looking for our house. She stopped me but I á ran away. When I arrived at home I found the same woman and she á told my parents what had happened so I felt ashamed.
label: shame

text_A: I went to my boyfrien's house. There I found clothes of a certain á girl. Without asking whose clothes they were I started tearing á them only to realise that they were his sister's and so I felt á guilty.
label: guilt

text_A: When I was selected to come here.
label: joy

text_A: Somebody told her friend that she would hit me wherever we would á meet.
label: fear

text_A: When I heard that my friend had started drinking beer.
label: sadness

text_A: I went to a party and there were some cakes which weren't good á and had a bad smell.
label: disgust

text_A: One day I was supposed to go to a movie with my boyfriend. In the á morning I went to see my Auntie and I didn't come back up to á evening.
label: shame

text_A: I slapped my sister's daughter and after several hours, she had a á high temperature and she ended up being admitted in hospital.
label: guilt

text_A: When the church choir came one Sunday after being away for some á weeks.
label: joy

text_A: When I came home late one day. I was afraid I would be shouted at á by my parents.
label: fear

text_A: I was watching T.V with my parents and some pornographic scenes á came on, I felt uncomfortable and tried to distract my parents á attention by talking to them.
label: sadness

text_A: I saw a program on T.V where they had to saw a skull for an        á operation.
label: disgust

text_A: When I decided not to out any longer with a girl whom I liked á quite a lot.  This made me feel low for a some time.
label: shame

text_A: When I had my first boyfriend.
label: joy

text_A: I and my cousin went to a filmshow at night. We went without á making it known to my mother. While we were there at interval, I á came across my mother just close to where we sat.
label: fear

text_A: During the Xmas holiday, I and my best friend at Secondary School á had planned to meet at a Cultural afternoon at the Mt. Soche á Hotel after missing each other for such a long time. When I asked á my mother for permission, she told me not to go for no good á reason. I felt very angry with her.
label: anger

text_A: I felt disgusted when my cousin decided that she would stop á going to school saying she wanted to get married. She was only 14 á years by then and she didn't understand what she was thinking.
label: disgust

text_A: When I failed my Primary school leaving Examinations. I never á thought I would fail. When I heard I had failed I really felt á ashamed of myself.
label: shame

text_A: One time I felt guilty when I told one of my previous boyfriends á we were through just because I never felt like having one at that á particular time.
label: guilt

text_A: I was filled with joy when I heard that I had been selected for a á University course.
label: joy

text_A: One day I was angry with my friend who went into my drawer and á took a piece of paper on which I wanted to write a letter and á used it for her business without my knowledge.
label: anger

text_A: I was disgusted with my brother's behaviour when he kept throwing á things away because of his anger, after mum had shouted at him.
label: disgust

text_A: I was ashamed with my biology lecturer when he asked me a á question and I could not answer it.
label: shame

text_A: I wrote a difficult Exam at one time while in my Secodary School. á When the results were announced on the radio, I came second out á of 80 students hence I felt joy.
label: joy

text_A: When the week for Exams came. I got afraid as to how I would á tackle the questions.
label: fear

text_A: I experienced this emotion when my grandfather passed away.
label: sadness

text_A: In my village there was this tax collector who used to cheat á people and collected more than was wanted, the surplus was for á his family and himself.
label: disgust

text_A: I felt ashamed when my lecturer said in class that I á happened to be the dullest of all.
label: shame

text_A: When I received a beautiful birthday gift form my parents.
label: joy

text_A: When I was called for an Interview at Kamuzu College of Nursing.
label: fear

text_A: When I damaged my wristwatch which I liked very much.
label: anger

text_A: When my cousin passed away.
label: sadness

text_A: When my fellow classmates were involved in a quarrel.
label: disgust

text_A: When I failed Psychology examination when most of the students á passed.
label: shame

text_A: When I promised to visit my boyfriend and I didn't fulfil the á promise.
label: guilt

text_A: I had stayed for months without seeing mother because our á holidays were short and my home is far. Some times, mother came to á see me at school, I was very joyful, and I didn't want her to go.
label: joy

text_A: One day during our clinical practices, we had a very ill patient. á Unfortunately the patient passed away. I had seen him dying and á it was the first experience. During the night I became afraid á fearing the dead body.
label: fear

text_A: My best friend had failed Exams. She had to leave and so we got á separated.
label: sadness

text_A: I felt disgusted when my appointment to meet the E.N.T. á specialist had been turned down. The specialist came from U.K. á and went the same day and we do not have one.
label: disgust

text_A: I had been telling lies and people discovered instantly that I á was telling lies. I felt very shameful and I felt like á disappearing from people.
label: shame

text_A: I had spent the weekend visiting relatives and friends and didn't á study for Anatomy class on Monday.
label: guilt

text_A: I had an interview for entry into college. The results were to be á announced on radio. After a long period of waiting the results á were released. I had succeded - tension was relieved by joy.
label: joy

text_A: When I heard that my Uncle had passed away in a road traffic á accident.
label: sadness

text_A: I went to a party with my boyfriend who got so drunk and started á vomiting. It was so disgusting.
label: disgust

text_A: I was keeping a friend's Library book which went overdue. My á friend was charged for the delay in returning the book to the á Library. I felt guilty when I realised I was responsible.
label: guilt

text_A: I was given a gift by my sister. There were many pleasant things á in this parcel.
label: joy

text_A: I was alone walking in a deserted part of the city and I had some á fear that some men would attack me and rob me.
label: fear

text_A: I wrote an Exam and happened to have not done as well as I á thought I would. I was angry to myself for not having done so á well.
label: anger

text_A: I lost my purse that had money in it. I was sad until I found it.
label: sadness

text_A: A friend of mine was shouting at me in a group of juniors.
label: shame

text_A: The day I was told that I had passed my Malawi School leaving á Exams and I was selected to go to college.
label: joy

text_A: When I was travelling home by bus and suddenly the bus hit and á the bus leaned against a wall.
label: fear

text_A: I was angry when someone stole a magazine which I had borrowed á from another friend and locked it in a drawer.
label: anger

text_A: When my best friend promised to come at my house and I had to á prepare so many expensive things for her but only to learn at á last that she would not turn up.
label: sadness

text_A: I felt ashamed one day when my teacher shouted at me in the á presence of my boyfriend.
label: shame

text_A: I was afraid when my boyfriend came home because my parents á disapproved him of his coming home. I thought they would chase me á out of the house.
label: fear

text_A: I was ashamed of being laughed at by my colleagues when I failed á to answer a question in the classroom.
label: shame

text_A: I was filled with joy when I heard that I had been selected to á come here at Kamuzu College of Nursing.
label: joy

text_A: I was afraid to walk through the forest one day when I dropped á off the bus around 6.30 pm.
label: fear

text_A: I was angry when somebody stole my half petticoat.
label: anger

text_A: I felt sad when my father was sick.
label: sadness

text_A: I felt disgusted when somebody told me that my previous boyfriend á was her boyfriend.
label: disgust

text_A: I was ashamed when my boyfriend went to sit with another girl á when he invited me to come to watch Drama festival.
label: shame

text_A: I felt guilt to have come back from home without seeing my father. á When I went home he was at work.
label: guilt

text_A: Afraid of a dead body.
label: fear

text_A: Cooks refused to give me food.
label: sadness

text_A: I saw a septic, smelling wound.
label: disgust

text_A: I cheated my boyfriend.
label: guilt

text_A: A boy I had been admiring so much asked me to go out with him.
label: joy

text_A: Sometime back another girl who was in terms with my ex-boyfriend á came to shout at me at twelve midnight. It was because she á thought I was still interested in the boy.
label: anger

text_A: In May 18th, 1984 my boyfriend went to the U.S.A. In December I á was told he passed away. He had cancer of the Oesophagus.
label: sadness

text_A: One day I was walking with my boyfriend. We met my ex-boyfriend á and out of jealousy he started calling me names.
label: disgust

text_A: My father who is very quiet discovered I was going out with a á coloured boy. He called me names and was really upset.
label: shame

text_A: I was at a boarding school during my primary school days. I was á broken so I pretended I was very sick. My father came and he á picked me up. He spent a lot of money on medical expenses which á all proved to be negative.
label: guilt

text_A: When I passed standard 8 exams I jumped, rolled over the ground.
label: joy

text_A: I felt so afraid when dad fell ill, he had never suffered from á that disease since and I had never seen him as he was.
label: fear

text_A: It was extremely sad to me when I heard that a patient who I was á taking care of in hospital had passed away. He had some abdominal á pains.
label: sadness

text_A: At one time while at primary school I lost a pencil case of a á friend and I didn't mention it to her until after a fortnight.
label: guilt

text_A: I failed my Nutrition paper which was the paper ending the á course.
label: shame

text_A: When a patient in the ward died (one who had been under my care). á I felt as if I didn't give the appropriate care to the patient.
label: guilt

text_A: I was afraid when my mother left me alone to live in our house á for one month.
label: fear

text_A: I was very sad when I heard that my uncle had passed away á untimely at home.
label: sadness

text_A: One day my friend told me that she had heard that I was moving á about with her boyfriend. I was disgusted with the news.
label: disgust

text_A: I was walking one day and I met a man who wanted to ask me about á my brother but I didn't stop to hear what he was saying. I was á ashamed when I found him at home and he told my brother what had á happened.
label: shame

text_A: When my boyfriend came form Rumphi to Lilongwe for a visit I was á very happy to see him and couldn't believe it was him with me.
label: joy

text_A: When I dream of anything terrifying I used to have fear for the á rest of the day that the dream might come true e.g., being beaten á (or eaten ?) by a snake.
label: fear

text_A: I had been in love with a certain young man who pretended to love á me but one day I found out that he had another girlfriend who was á also a friend of mine.
label: anger

text_A: I wrote a letter to my boyfriend but he couldn't answer it in á time so as a defence mechanism I just found that I felt so sad á about it and couldn't talk to anyone.
label: sadness

text_A: I was once chatting with friends. Then some boys came and joined á us. These boys took all my 3 friends away and I was left alone in á shame without knowing where to go from there.
label: shame

text_A: When I heard that I had passed my end of first year exams and I á was ready to enter 2nd year because I felt I had failed as they were á very hard.
label: joy

text_A: I broke a window of a neighbouring house and I feared my mother's á judgement and action on what I had done.
label: fear

text_A: The headmistress at a secondary school accused me of banging the á classroom door when I didn't in front of the whole class.
label: anger

text_A: The carterer refused to give me sugar to add to my tea saying á that there was no sugar whilst it was there, so I left the cafe á disgusted without taking the tea.
label: disgust

text_A: I insulted my friend for a small reason and after time I realised á that I was wrong and felt ashamed; everytime I meet her I feel á ashamed.
label: shame

text_A: My patient died of Anaemia while I was organising blood á transfusion for him, so I felt guilty, because I thought that may á be I was slow.
label: guilt

text_A: When a thief entered the house in which I was sleeping.
label: fear

text_A: When my dress was stolen.
label: anger

text_A: When my grandmother died after a long illness.
label: sadness

text_A: When I boarded Yanu Yanu bus I sat near a man who was smoking á tobacco.
label: disgust

text_A: When I refused to fetch water for my aunty while she was busy.
label: shame

text_A: I was angry at the Cafeteria when the cook scolded and said many á bad things about me without reason. He thought I was among the á girls who did him wrong.
label: anger

text_A: I felt guilty because I stole some sweets from my father's á grocery. When he asked me who stole the sweets I told him it was á my brother who stole the sweets and he was scolded.
label: guilt

text_A: When I heard that my father had passed away. I could not eat for á a week and was only crying. I could not find the courage to go to á bath.
label: sadness

text_A: When I wet my head (or bed ?) one day my sister discovered it and reported á it to the other siblings. So my mother had to scold me.
label: shame

text_A: It was in 1983 September when MCE results were being announced on á the radio. When I heard my name that I had done well I just kept á quiet. I was so happy that I couldn't even talk.
label: joy

text_A: I was on my way home when suddenly Gule Wamkulu came from the á bush and blocked the road. I was in fear and didn't know what to á do.
label: fear

text_A: When I went home on holidays I found that my niece and nephew had á passed away I was very sad for the children were not even sick á before death but suddenly died.
label: sadness

text_A: I met a certain lady at the bus depot who was using a bad á language but was a very smart looking lady.
label: disgust

text_A: I wore a dirty dress a certain day I was going to town I met an á old friend who made a comment about my dress so I felt ashamed.
label: shame

text_A: One day I shouted at my brother who didn't do any wrong to me á only that I had a disappointment from a friend and projected it á on to him. He cried and I felt guilty after sometime.
label: guilt

text_A: I was joyful when I received a present (2 books and a pencil) á from the headmaster in standard 6 because I had passed, I became á No 1 and he said I was one of the pupils who had good behaviour.
label: joy

text_A: I went to the prayer meeting at night and unfortunately the car á broke down, so my other sister said I had to walk alone from á Ndirande to Chirimba at around midnight. So we reached home at á 1 am. I was afraid of robbers and dardness.
label: fear

text_A: I was angry the other day because the teacher told me to sweep á some orange peels. It was my friends who were supposed to sweep, á but the teacher told me to do it.
label: anger

text_A: I was really shameful when my mother beat me in the presence of á my friends because I didn't cook lunch up until 2 o'clock.
label: shame

text_A: I was afraid when I met my Uncle because this time I was with my á boyfriend I thought I was not going to be given pocket money.
label: fear

text_A: I was angry when I had not been granted a leave out pass during á the last weekend.
label: anger

text_A: I was sad to hear that my brother had a motorbike accident.
label: sadness

text_A: I was disgusted when my little sister had been hit badly by her á friends.
label: disgust

text_A: I felt guilty when I had refused to lend money to my friend who á needed it immediately.
label: guilt

text_A: Somebody took my wristwatch and promised to have it mended and á later was telling me that he couldn't give it back to me because I was á rude at a certain time.
label: anger

text_A: My boyfriend didn't turn up after promising that he was coming.
label: sadness

text_A: I was forced to go to a party with someone I didn't love and he á was telling people that I was his girlfriend.
label: disgust

text_A: When a certain drunk man slapped my buttocks when I was quietly á standing waiting for a bus.
label: shame

text_A: I borrowed my friend's radio cassette and the plug cracked and á some pieces broke off when the plug dropped off my hands.
label: guilt

text_A: After passing my Malawi Certificate of Education Exam and being á selected to Kamuzu College of Nursing.
label: joy

text_A: I was sleeping alone in the house at night. A boy putting on a á short only knocked at the window whispering that I should open á for him.
label: fear

text_A: The patient whom I expected to get well suddenly passed away á after he showed had his meals.
label: anger

text_A: I was told I shouldn't visit my sister because the holiday was á short.
label: disgust

text_A: I was the last among the list of failures in my class of Biology.
label: shame

text_A: The time when my sister had her first baby I was so happy and á joyous because she stayed for two days after marriage before she á had a child.
label: joy

text_A: Sometime back I used to stay with my mum alone then time came á when dad joined the family from his working place I found myself á having fear for him for no cause at all.
label: fear

text_A: I was so angry with a patient who refused to take drugs.
label: anger

text_A: I felt joyful when I heard that I had been selected for College á education.
label: joy

text_A: I felt angry when my friend told me that I had stolen her money.
label: anger

text_A: I felt disgust when I saw a drunkard vomiting very offensive á matter.
label: disgust

text_A: I flet shameful when I learnt that I cooked Nsima which was full á of lamps in it.
label: shame

text_A: I received money from my father at a time when I was completely á broken.
label: joy

text_A: One of my friends went and told another friend of mine that I was á going abut with another guy in Lilongwe besides the one I had. á She said I was seen with him hand in hand.
label: anger

text_A: I received a letter form home telling me that my sister was very sick.
label: sadness

text_A: I fell off a bike in the presence of a lot of people.
label: shame

text_A: A person misinterpreted what I had told her. I had told her that á I had failed to insert a NasoGastric tube but she went and á scolded the patient that she was being uncooperative.
label: guilt

text_A: I had fear of my father (parents) when I first became pregnant. I á was afraid of delivery itself and whether I would give birth to a á stiiborn or a baby.
label: fear

text_A: It was when I discovered that my boyfriend had another girl. I á discovered it through a letter he wrote to the girl when he was á away. When I asked him he accepted it.
label: anger

text_A: My father promised to send me pocket money at the month-end since á I wanted to buy a new pair of shoes when I was at secondary á school, but he didn't.
label: disgust

text_A: I just opened the bathroom without knocking not knowing that á someone was bathing inside, it happened to be my father.
label: shame

text_A: I beat my young sister because she refused to wash plates. She á started crying and I felt sorry and guilty for what I did.
label: guilt

text_A: Accepted by the college football team.
label: joy

text_A: Made mistakes in exam.
label: anger

text_A: Given duty by the leaders which I do not like to do.
label: disgust

text_A: Make a mistake, offended my friend.
label: guilt

text_A: Walking on a dark street with noone around.
label: fear

text_A: My grandmother died.
label: sadness

text_A: Did not finish homework.
label: shame

text_A: Did not read reference when other people read them.
label: guilt

text_A: Before examination.
label: fear

text_A: People not cueing in the college dining room.
label: disgust

text_A: Helping in the nursery school.
label: joy

text_A: Not being accepted by classmates in university.
label: sadness

text_A: Waiting for a bus not coming for a long time, and the bus drivers á were having a long lunch.
label: disgust

text_A: Not having good marks like other people for homeworks.
label: shame

text_A: Not handing in homeworks in time.
label: guilt

text_A: Got a present from my friend for my birthday.
label: joy

text_A: Lost my purse, the money in the purse belonged to my parents.
label: fear

text_A: South Korea winning more gold medals in the Asian Olympic (more á than China).
label: anger

text_A: Saw my roommate messing up our room.
label: disgust

text_A: Found out that I am not good at football.
label: shame

text_A: Gave the wrong meal tickets to other people (my classmate).
label: guilt

text_A: Damaged the tap in the residental Hall.
label: fear

text_A: Too many people in TV room, I was not able to get a seat to watch á TV.
label: anger

text_A: My sister marrying a bad man. He is cruel to her.
label: sadness

text_A: Saw my brother-in-law insulting my sister.
label: disgust

text_A: Discussing psychology with my friends before the lecture.
label: joy

text_A: Waking up from a bad dream in a dark night with noone else á around.
label: fear

text_A: I could not find my monthly tickets for the bus when I was on the á bus.
label: anger

text_A: Two little children (5/6 years old) begging for money, and noone á gave them money.
label: sadness

text_A: The serving lady in the students' dining hall shouting at á studennts.
label: disgust

text_A: Passing by a good friend's home without coming in to visit him.
label: guilt

text_A: You told me psychology can help people to be happier.
label: joy

text_A: Left alone in the dining hall at night.
label: fear

text_A: Not quick enough to help the lectors to catty things for the á lecture.
label: shame

text_A: My parents came to visit me.
label: joy

text_A: Saw in the TV South Korea cheating in the Asian Olympic games.
label: anger

text_A: A girl I do not like kept coming to me and talking to me.
label: disgust

text_A: Failing an examn.
label: shame

text_A: Getting lost in a strange place.
label: fear

text_A: South Korea cheating for gold medals.
label: anger

text_A: When I was the South Koreans on the TV.
label: disgust

text_A: Zhu Jianhau did not break the world record for China.
label: shame

text_A: Unable to help my mother to cook.
label: guilt

text_A: I met a friend I had not seen for a long time on the street.
label: joy

text_A: Going to the examn not well prepared.
label: fear

text_A: Hearing about developments of sience in the West a lot better á than China.
label: sadness

text_A: Not being able to be selected for the dancing team.
label: shame

text_A: Did not get up early enough to watch my class football team á playing against another team.
label: guilt

text_A: Scoared a goal in a football match.
label: joy

text_A: Left alone in the dark in a big building.
label: fear

text_A: Someone called me a disgusting nickname.
label: anger

text_A: Not getting on with someone of my classmates in high school.
label: sadness

text_A: Not brave enough to take up a challenge in a group discussion.
label: shame

text_A: Not being a good host for a friend from a far away place.
label: guilt

text_A: Walking alone in the dark in a strange street.
label: fear

text_A: A friend misunderstood me.
label: sadness

text_A: Being miserable in a party when other people are friendly and á happy.
label: guilt

text_A: Meeting an old friend from high school.
label: joy

text_A: Getting into a crowded bus.
label: disgust

text_A: Being rude to somebody who was impolite to me.
label: shame

text_A: Not accepting hints of intimate relation from a girl.
label: guilt

text_A: Listening to horrot stories at night.
label: fear

text_A: My roommate was rude to me.
label: anger

text_A: My uncle died in the Vietnam War.
label: sadness

text_A: Cueing in the students dining hall.
label: disgust

text_A: Arguing about price with private shop-assistant.
label: shame

text_A: Not being able to spend more time with a friend who was visiting á me.
label: guilt

text_A: Scoring a goal in football match.
label: joy

text_A: Finding out that I am not an as able student as I thought.
label: fear

text_A: I was told to do something I did not want to do.
label: anger

text_A: Finding out that China is still backward in science.
label: sadness

text_A: Doing this pointless questionnaire.
label: disgust

text_A: Insulted by somebody.
label: shame

text_A: Just arrived in the university, not knowing anybody.
label: fear

text_A: Insulted by teacher.
label: anger

text_A: Finding out I am not good looking.
label: sadness

text_A: Finding out from this lecture that China is backward in á psychology.
label: shame

text_A: Being rude to someone I do not like.
label: guilt

text_A: Joining in a research group studying consumer's behaviour and á helping the people in the shop with the sales.
label: joy

text_A: Diagnosis that I have a stomache ulcer.
label: fear

text_A: Not winning a medal in the swimming contest.
label: sadness

text_A: Some students talking when other people are having a nap.
label: disgust

text_A: A friend asked for help and I was not able to help.
label: guilt

text_A: China winning the Asian Olympic.
label: joy

text_A: Before an examn.
label: fear

text_A: My father left us for another woman.
label: sadness

text_A: Saw my father with that woman he is married to now.
label: disgust

text_A: Had to tell people that my parents are divorced.
label: shame

text_A: Heard about someone telling lies about me to my best friend.
label: anger

text_A: My best friend suddenly acting strange towards me.
label: sadness

text_A: Saw someone messing up our room.
label: disgust

text_A: After shouting at a friend.
label: shame

text_A: Did not do what I promised to do for a friend.
label: guilt

text_A: My class leader told me the university won't let all of us go to á your lectures because we are not All English Class.
label: anger

text_A: Finding out that the class leader can go to your lectures, and á his English is worse than mine.
label: disgust

text_A: China cannot let you give more lectures because you are needed in á the specialist clinics. We are so backward in medicine.
label: shame

text_A: I hated you for not letting me go and found out that it was not á your decision.
label: guilt

text_A: Heard some postgraduate students talking about girls being á unsiutable to do medicine.
label: disgust

text_A: Receiving a letter from a boy I care.
label: joy

text_A: Watching a horror film.
label: fear

text_A: Saw someone spitting in public.
label: disgust

text_A: Failing in an examn because of lazyness.
label: shame

text_A: Losing my temper to my sister.
label: guilt

text_A: Finding out that I can go to your English lectures.
label: joy

text_A: Staying alone in a dark place.
label: fear

text_A: Finding out that my best friend could not go to university.
label: sadness

text_A: Some boys not cueing in the dining hall.
label: disgust

text_A: Watching TV about china is behind in winning gold medals.
label: shame

text_A: Beaten up by a classmate in school.
label: fear

text_A: A girl I love does not love me.
label: sadness

text_A: Saw some girls dressed up like Americans
label: disgust

text_A: Getting into this university to do medicine.
label: joy

text_A: Misunderstood by a close friend for the wrong reason.
label: anger

text_A: Finding out that China is poor, so we cannot have good reference á books.
label: sadness

text_A: Finding out that the university police was afraid to stop the á foreign students playing loud music (China's shame).
label: shame

text_A: Not doing well in the examn.
label: guilt

label: sadness

label: fear

text_A: One of my best friends was hurt by a girl he loves.
label: sadness
